loans.name: William

texts.en:
William was born in Isabela and has been a farmer for many years. He is not married but lives in partnership with Ravelin who is a housewife. He lives and works on his land some ten kilometers from the town of Ilagan. He works in agriculture growing corn.

 William is asking for a loan of P 15,000 to purchase corn seed and fertilizer so that his harvest will be good. In this area there is no drinking water and life is difficult as they have to bring the water from distant places or draw it from wells. He has seen the necessity of building a water tank. 

In the future, William hopes that his business will expand so he can have a good quality of life.

loans.use: to buy corn seed and fertilizer for his farming business.

loans.name: Jimmy

texts.en:
Jimmy is a thirty-one-year-old man living in Masindi, Uganda. He deals in textiles. He started with 500,000 Uganda shillings (UGX), which he saved from his salary, and he now has 2,000,000 UGX as his working capital. Price fluctuations, taxes, and transport costs hinder his business. 

Jimmy wants a loan to buy clothes to resell. His dream is to educate his children and build a permanent house. His business dream is to diversify and expand into new markets.

loans.use: To buy clothes to resell.

loans.name: Silva

texts.en:
Silva is a 21 year old married woman with one child who is not in school. For two years, she has had a business selling groundnuts (peanuts) in Kator, South Sudan.

Silva requested this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase groundnuts. she will use her extra income from this loan to build a house in the future.

loans.use: to purchase groundnuts (peanuts) for sale.

loans.name: Concepcion

texts.en:
Concepcion is 48 years old and married with 5 children, with 1 child in school. Concepcion works very hard to provide for them.

Concepcion runs a Variety Store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy more items to sell. She has been in this business for 5 years and sells a variety of items such as snack foods, noodles and other miscellaneous items. 

Concepcion would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell in her store

loans.name: Evergreen Ladies Group

texts.en: This is 29 year-old Letween from Harare, the capital of Zimbabwe . She is single with one child. She also cares for one dependent who is still going to school. Letween runs a services business of tailoring ladies' wear. The business has been in operation for seven years. She says the main challenges faced are competition and the market as the market is becoming crowded. Letween has requested a loan of $400.00 in order to buy tailoring materials. She says the extra income generated as a result of this loan will allow her to be able to complete the building of her house allocated by the local Authority. In the future, Letween plans to own a tailoring factory with industrial machines.

loans.use: to buy tailoring materials.

loans.name: Ajok

texts.en:
Ajok is 35-year-old married woman with four children, all of whom are in school. For four years, she has had a business selling food items in Bor, South Sudan. 

Ajok is requesting this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase sugar and oil. She will use the extra income generated from this loan to pay the school fees of her children.

loans.use: to purchase sugar and oil to sell.

loans.name: Salomón Antonio

texts.es: Salomón Antonio de treinta y seis años de edad vive junto a su compañera de vida; él se dedica a la venta de minutas de todos los sabores fresa, tamarindo, piña, menta, entre otros, tiene varios años de trabajar en este negocio y se ha hecho de experiencia valiosa en las ventas; comercia de forma ambulante en diferentes zonas de la localidad y ya tiene mucha clientela que lo prefiere porque siempre tiene lo que necesitan con producto de primera calidad y a precios accesibles además el servicio es inigualable; Salomón es un hombre emprendedor con muchas ganas de salir adelante desea aprovechar todas las oportunidades que se le presenten para así poder alcanzar el éxito;  una de sus más grandes metas es hacer crecer su negocio pero necesita de capital para la compra de insumos por eso le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar jarabes de sabores, leche, tamarindo, vasos, cucharas, etc. Salomón Antonio es muy responsable y con capacidad de pago tiene la certeza que cancelara la deuda y a la vez le dará a su familia la vida que se merecen.

loans.use: jarabes de sabores, leche, tamarindo, vasos, cucharas

loans.name: Maribel

texts.es:
La socia nació en la provincia de La Convención pero vive en la hermosa ciudad del Cusco, ella tiene 43 años de edad es soltera, ella pertenece al banco comunal “Santa Rosita de Lima” de la Asociación Arariwa.

Su actividad económica principal es la distribución de productos energéticos como por ejemplo Red Bull, Burn, Maltin Power y entre otros. Ya son dos años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien. En esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar más productos energéticos. Agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
This member was born in the province of La Convención but she lives in the beautiful city of Cuzco.  She is 43 years old and single. She belongs to the communal bank “Santa Rosita de Lima” which belongs to the Asociación Arariwa.

Her main business activity is the distribution of energy products such as Red Bull, Burn, Maltin Power and others. She has been involved in this business for two years and it is going very well. On this occasion, Maribel needs the loan to purchase more energy products. Maribel is grateful to those who, by means of these funds, enable her to fulfil her aspirations, and she promises to pay the installments on time.

loans.use: to buy more energy products.

loans.name: Mayita Tatiana

texts.es: La cliente reside en la ciudad de Portoviejo.  Tiene 11 años laborando en este negocio, debido a que desde siempre le ha gustado la costura.  Trabaja todos los días y cuando tiene mucho por hacer, su hija le ayuda con sus labores.  Al momento está separada del papá de sus hijas.  Tiene 4 hijas, la mayor es casada y las demás tienen 17, 15 y 14 años.  La segunda hija va a la universidad y las otras 2 asisten a la escuela fiscal de su sector.  A futuro le gustaría que su taller de costura sea más grande, expandirse más y ser reconocida; asimismo, desea que sus hijas puedan desarrollarse profesionalmente.  Ahora necesita invertir el dinero del crédito en la compra de telas, hilos y demás artículos de costura.
texts.en: This client lives in the city of Portoviejo.  She’s been working in this business for 11 years because she’s always liked to sew.  She works every day and when she has much work to do her daughter helps her with the work.  At the moment she’s separated from her daughters’ father.  She has four daughters.  The oldest is married and the others are 17, 15 and 14 years old.  The second one attends university and the other two the local public school.  In future she’d like to have a larger sewing workshop, to expand more and to become well-known.  Also, she wants her daughters to develop professionally.  She needs to use the loan money  to buy fabric, thread and other sewing supplies.

loans.use: to buy sewing supplies.

loans.name: Godfrey

texts.en:
Godfrey is a 47-year-old year old married man with eight children all attending different schools. He is a farmer who works five days a week and six hours a day. He is motivated by the profitability of the business.

He is also a cattle trader. From this business, he gets additional income to support his family and has been in this business since 1993. He usually sells his agricultural products to fellow traders in Kalisizo and Bulinda trading centre and surrounding areas. He hopes to use the loan acquired to buy more cows for fattening. However, he faces a challenge of untrustworthy customers who take goods on credit and delay payments.

He is described as a hardworking and honest man and is appreciative of the services offered.  He is hardworking and optimistic that his business will boom in the long run.

loans.use: To buy baby cows that he will fatten and later sell

loans.name: Kathy Katrina

texts.es: KATHY KATRINA: Es una señora trabajadora, que lucha día a día para mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia, pertenece a la etnia miskita del municipio de Puerto Cabezas, tiene 38 años de edad, casada con 2 hijos en edad escolar. Su esposo trabaja de manera informal, como ayudante en las embarcaciones. Desde hace más de 12 años se dedica al alquiler de cuartos, de esta manera cuenta con su propia fuente de ingresos, contribuye con los gastos del hogar y educación de sus hijos. Solicita financiamiento para mejorar la infraestructura, condiciones de los cuartos. Con el préstamo comprara materiales de construcción. Su sueño es construir más cuartos, debido al incremento de la demanda y comercializar mariscos.

loans.use: para mejorar la infraestructura, condiciones de los cuartos que alquila

loans.name: Daisy

texts.en:
Daisy is a young student that is studying engineering. She sells make-up to her community and her fellow students in order to finance her education. Her parents are also microentrepreneurs but they have very modest businesses and they do not make enough to cover all of Daisy’s costs. She started this business with only $100 of her own savings. After a year she has done well and has also begun to sell women’s clothing.

She is seeking a loan because she wants to further invest in her business. She is a good saleswoman and sees that she could sell more if she could afford to buy larger quantities of her product. Her goal is to be self sufficient and attain her college degree.

Mifex offers its clients microinsurance and access to business training and educational programs. For more information about microfinance, Ecuador, and our services, please visit www.mifex.org.

loans.use: Buy cosmetics and women\\\'s clothing in bulk

loans.name: Suluama

texts.en:
Suluama lives in the village of Faleasiu, where she was born and raised, with her husband and five children, four of which are in school and one is a one year-old baby.

She has always dreamed of having a business of her own, and her dream has now come true with the help of the SPBDF.  She believes that her business will grow in the future by satisfying her customers by providing them with the best service and products.

Suluama is assisted by her husband and two brothers who help her run business by planting cabbages, tomatoes and pumpkins, and by weeding and picking up small stones.

She is applying for a loan of $900 in order to purchase piglets and repair their pigpens.

loans.use: To purchase additional piglets, and improve the pigpens

loans.name: Celina Amador

texts.en:
I have been making and selling tortillas for four years. I have two school-aged children. My best customers are my neighbors.

Translated by a Kiva volunteer

Mi negocio es la elaboracion y venta de tortillas desde hace 4 años. tengo dos hijos en edad escolar y mis mejores clientes son mis vecinos de la comunidad

loans.use: To buy corn for making tortillas

loans.name: Margarita

texts.es:
Margarita is 40 years old and is married to Victor, who is 44 years old. They have 1 daughter who is 15 years old and studies in the national school in their area. We are told that their daughter is one of the best pupils in the school and she always fills them with priD. and happiness. The family live in a rural area 45 km from the city of Encarnación. They produce fruits and salad vegetables. Their production system is manual and her husband has 3 helpers who care for the products like lettuce, cabbage, tomatoes, beans, mandioca (a popular Paraguayan root) and fruits such as oranges, mandarins, lemons and bananas. Margarita is the one who sells these products in the central market of Encarnación on Thursday, Friday and Saturday every week. They would like a loan to enlarge their production area so that they can meet the increase in demand for their products in the market. The money will be invested in seeds and products of the care of lettuces, onions and potatoes.

Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer

La Sra. Margarita tiene 40 años D. edad y está casada con el Sr. Víctor D. 44 años, tienen una hija D. 15 años, quien estudia en el colegio nacional D. la zona, ella nos cuenta que su hija es una D. las mejores alumnas D. su colegio y siempre les llena D. orgullo y alegría. La familia vive en un área rural distante a 45 km D. la ciudad D. Encarnación, se dedican a la producción D. frutas y hortalizas en general. Su sistema D. producción es manual, su esposo con tres ayudantes se encargan del cuidado D. los cultivos, como ser: lechugas, repollos, tomates, zapallos, choclos, locotes (morrones), porotos, mandioca (raíz muy consumida en el Paraguay), y frutas como: naranjas, mandarinas, limones y bananas. La Sra. Margarita es la encargada D. comercializar la producción en la feria municipal D. la ciudad D. Encarnación, los días jueves, viernes y sábados D. todas las semanas. Solicita el crédito para ampliación D. su área D. cultivo, debido al aumento D. las demandas D. sus productos en la feria, el dinero será invertido en la compra D. semillas e insumos para el cultivo D. D. lechugas, cebollas, papa y choclos.

loans.use: To buy seed and ingredients for planting lettuce, onions etc/Compra de semillas e insumos para plantación de lechugas, cebollas y choclos.

loans.name: Olga Elias

texts.pt:
Olga is married, currently separated. She has 4 children, who are all in school. She used to be a Bank clerk. She now works in a security company and owns a small store where she sells basic products. Olga’s husband left her and moved to the north region. She is requesting this loan in order to increase the stock of her small store. Olga’s children are all in school, and she is working hard to support them after her husband left. She has been able to repay the loans she requested before and invest in her small business.

She joined the Women Development Funds in 2005. She has been able to improve her home. Olga is also very good at managing her business and has been making payments in a timely manner.

Translated from Portuguese by Mariana Komatsuzaki Fraga, Kiva Volunteer.

Olga e casada mas de momento esta separada do marido. Ela tem 4 filhos e todos estao a estudar. Outrora ela foi funcionaria de um banco Comercial. Agora trabalha numa empresa de Seguranca. Ela tem uma pequena loja onde vende produtos de primeira necessidade. O marido abandonou-lhe e foi radicar-se na zona norte do Pais.. Ela quer tomar este emprestimo para adquirir mais produtos paraa sua lojinha que se situa num dos bairros limitrofes da cidade.. Todos os seus filhos estao a estudar e ela consegue sustenta-los apesar de o marido ter-lhe abandonado. Ela conseguiu pagar dividas que ele tinha contraido e ainda conseguiu fundos para aplicar na lojinha.

Ela entrou para o Programa de credito do Fundo de desenvolvimento da Mulher em 2005. Ela tem uma casa melhorada e consegue gerir muito bem o seu negocio. Ela paga pontualmente as suas dividas.

loans.use: Olga is requesting a loan to purchase products for her grocery store

loans.name: Maritza

texts.es:
Maritza is a young mother who lives in a little dwelling with her baby and her beloved husband. She began to work thanks to the help of her mother-in-law, because she couldn’t find work and wanted to contribute to the household income, which put a lot of pressure on her and worried her a lot. She began her culinary journey by initially helping in the kitchen with the preparation of the exquisite dishes typical of her city. She learned very quickly thanks to the dedication of her mother-in-law and with the help of her husband, who suggested the brilliant idea of selling her exquisite vegetable stews in her workplace. In this way, little by little she began to see the results of her work and the well-being that her work gave her family. Due to the popularity and good flavor that she offers in her exquisite dishes, she now needs to buy kitchen utensils, just as the most important thing is a kitchen supplied with a gas canister so she can keep her clients who support her daily sales. Maritza hopes that she can count on our support to continue improving her service and work toward progress for her family.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Westin, Kiva volunteer.

Maritza es una joven madre, habita una pequeña morada con su pequeño y su querido esposo.Comenzó a trabajar gracias a la ayuda de su suegra ya que no conseguía trabajo y el deseo de contribuir con la economía de su hogar la apremiaba y preocupaba mucho. Inició su travesía culinaria inicialmente ayudando en la cocina con la preparación de los exquisitos platos típicos de su ciudad y aprendió en forma muy rápida gracias a la dedicación de su suegra y con el apoyo que contó de su esposo debido a que le sugirió la brillante idea de repartir los exquisitos potajes en su centro de trabajo; así poco a poco empezó a ver los resultados de su trabajo y el bienestar que generaba su desempeño a su familia..Debido a la aceptación y buen sabor que ofrece en sus exquisitos platos, se encuentra en la necesidad de comprar utensilios de cocina, así como lo más importante que es una cocina provista de un balón de gas para cumplir con sus clientes ya que respaldan sus ventas diarias.Maritza espera contar con nuestro apoyo para poder seguir mejorando su servicio y trabajar por el progreso de su familia.

loans.use: Buy kitchen utensils

loans.name: Mabinty

texts.en:
Mabinty is 30 years old with 4 children and is married to a subsistence farmer who can hardly grow enough food for the family. She started a small business with her meager savings from the farm products. She later obtained a loan from SMT and spent part of the loan on farming and part was invested in the business to enable her to pay back the installments on a monthly basis.

Mabinty is proud that the family has increased their rice harvest because of the loan. She is requesting another loan to increase her business stock to generate more income to be invested in the farm in the coming season in April.

loans.use: to buy larger quantities of food items so that she can cook more and sell more

loans.name: Mohammad Ali

texts.en:
Mohammad Ali lives in district 5 of Kabul, Afghanistan. He is single and a very talented young man. He lives with his own family and has a retail shop where he works part-time.

He would like to expand his business so he wants to take out an individual loan to buy extra inventory such as baskets, powders, shampoos, and different food items to attract more clients and make a good monthly income to support his family. This will assure him and his family of a brighter future. He is very happy to have the opportunity to get this loan.

loans.use: To buy extra materials like baskets, powders, shampoos

loans.name: Divinas Group

texts.es:
Las Divinas , or The Divine Ladies, is the name of this Community Association in Villa Tejada, and for more than a year and a half they have worked constantly to make their businesses prosper.

They are a total of seventeen women whose occupations vary from creating fine artwork to selling vegetables and running grocery stores to running a hostel and preparing fast food.

All these activities demand great sacrifice on the part of these businesswomen, given that their income and earnings are minimal throughout the year, and they must take advantage of those parties that bring in large crowds. For example, the parties of Carnaval bring in many consumers as well as tourism, which in the case of the businesswoman who runs a hostel represents a big opportunity to bring in income that will keep her business afloat.

Unfortunately, the competition in this field does not allow our associate to earn enough to be able to invest in improving and remodeling her hostel, much less to be able to expand the facility and be able to bring her guests greater comfort.

For this reason, these businesswomen need cash to invest in their businesses so that they can compete in the market that will be created by the Carnaval parties and other parties throughout the year.

Translated from Spanish by Shannon Skoglund, Kiva volunteer.

Las Divinas, ese es el nombre de la Asociación Comunal de Villa Tejada, que hace más de un año y medio trabajan constantemente con el fin de prosperar con sus negocios.

Un total de 17 mujeres cuya ocupación varía, desde la elaboración de artesanías, pasando por la venta de verduras, tiendas de abarrotes, hasta la atención de un hostal y preparación de comida rápida.

Todas estas actividades demandan gran sacrificio de parte de estas socias, puesto que sus ingresos y ganancias son mínimas durante el año, y deben aprovechar aquellas fiestas que mueven grandes masas. Por ejemplo las fiestas de carnaval generan gran movimiento consumista, y al mismo tiempo generan turismo, lo que en el caso de la socia que posee su hostal representa una gran oportunidad para generar ingresos importantes para mantener vivo su negocio.

Lastimosamente la competitividad en el rubro no permite que nuestra socia genere los recursos necesarios por no poder invertir en mejoras y refacciones a su hostal, menos en la posibilidad de ampliación de infraestructura, mucho menos en gastos que generen mayor comodidad a sus huéspedes.

Por tal motivo, las socias precisan de capital para poder invertir en sus negocios y de esta manera competir dentro del mercado que se va a generar en las fiestas de carnavales y otras que se dan durante el año.

loans.use: Invest in their business for the high season during the parties of Carnaval

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase more equipment and hire more employees

loans.name: Željana

texts.en: Željana is from Štrpci, a small village near the town of  Prnjavor. She is not married and she works in a coffee shop which she owns. Željana can earn about US$ 400 monthly. This is her first loan in the amount of US$ 500. Željana will use it  for  supplies.  Her wish is to expand what she offers in her coffee shop  in order to increase her monthly income.

loans.use: for supplies to expand her little cafe

loans.name: María Gisela

texts.en:
María Gisela has been cooking for more than eight years in the Don Gregorio community of San Cristobal; her hometown. Her breakfasts and lunches are just delicious and the customers are very satisfied with her professionalism and the good quality of her dishes. María Gisela remembers that it was an uphill struggle to position herself as one of the best cooks in the community because of the rough competition. Currently, she has a well established clientele and her business keeps on growing.

With her loan, this entrepreneur will buy more chairs and tables in order to allow people to enjoy their food comfortably. María Gisela’s husband passed away four years ago, so she has to support her five children on her own.

loans.use: Purchase some tables and chairs for a small cafeteria.

loans.name: Martha

texts.es:
Martha is a responsible and very loving woman. Day to day she eagerly manages her small general store, in which she sells groceries to the members of her community in order to earn income and her family’s wellbeing. Her ongoing commitment and kindheartedness has brought her much satisfaction. She now wishes to improve her business space in order to offer her customers greater comfort.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

Martha, es una mujer responsable y muy amorosa. Día a Día se desenvuelve muy contenta y con mucho ahínco en su pequeña tiendita de abarrotes desde donde oferta sus productos a los miembros de su comunidad para obtener ganancias en bienestar de su familia. Su continuidad y amabilidad le han dado muchas satisfacciones y ahora desea mejorar su espacio para brindarle mayor comodidad a sus clientes.

loans.use: Expansion of business space for greater customer comfort

loans.name: Adriana Asunción

texts.es:
Sra. Adriana Asunción G. M. was born in the town of Bluefields. She is 30 years old and is married to Sr. Carlos Bladimir Obando who is a construction worker. The minimum wage he earns does not cover the cost of basic necessities. They have two young children.

For the last year Sra. G. has been the owner of a general store. Her customers are the people from the neighbourhood who like her store because of the variety of goods she offers (grains, juices, soups, soft drinks, natural fruit juices etc.) With the income from her business, she pays for her children’s education.

It should be noted that the products that she offers are in high demand. Right now she needs to buy 2 100K sacks of rice ($48 per sack), 2 100K sacks of sugar ($43 per sack), 1 drum of cooking oil ($40), and 1 100K sack of beans ($50). By investing in these products, Sra.G. will increase her income and satisfy her customers’ demands.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva volunteer.

La Sra. Adriana Asunción G. M. es originaria de la ciudad de Bluefields, tiene 30 años de edad, esta casada con el Sr. Carlos Bladimir Obando quien trabaja como obrero de construcción el cual devenga un salario mínimo que no cubre todos los pagos de los gastos básicos, ambos tienen 2 hijos menores de edad.

La Sra. G. es propietaria de una pulpería hace 1 año teniendo como clientes a los habitantes de su barrio que la prefieren por ofrecer variedades de productos (granos básicos, jugos, sopas, gaseosas, refrescos naturales, entre otras cosas) con el ingreso de su negocio paga los estudios de sus hijos.

Cabe destacar que los productos que ella oferta no a disminuido su demanda ya que son de alto consumo para la población. En estos momentos necesita comprar: 2 quintales de arroz a $ 48.00 dólares el quintal, 2 quintales de azúcar a $ 43.00 dólares el quintal, 1 bidones de aceite a $ 40.00 dólares el bidón, 1 quintales de frijoles a $ 50.00 dólares el quintal, con esta inversión podrá aumentar su ganancia y satisfacer la demanda de sus clientes.

loans.use: To buy rice, sugar, oil, beans, and soap for washing clothes.

loans.name: Urafiki Group

texts.en:
Agness has been selling clothes in Arusha for eight years. She is 40 years old, married, and has two children, ages 15 and 12. She works from 8:00am to 6:00pm every day and is able to generate a monthly profit of approximately $200.

Agness is taking out a loan to increase her inventory and expand her business. She will be sharing this loan with her four group members who also sell goods in Arusha.

loans.use: To buy more clothing to increase her business.

loans.name: Estela

texts.es:
Estela de 32 años, es madre soltera de 2 hijos, vive con su madre, a quien acogió en su casa y quien también la apoya mucho. 
Ella estudió cosmetología, dentro de su vivienda puso su salón de belleza, donde brinda servicios de corte de cabello, manicura, pedicura, entre otras cosas. Viene realizando este trabajo desde hace 4 años, durante casi todo el día. Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es que las personas que acuden a ella se vayan satisfechas con trabajo que les hizo y le gusta conversar mucho con sus clientes. Lo difícil para ella es no contar con un local adecuado.   
Ella quiere mandar a construir en una parte de su terreno un local, para su salón de belleza y desde luego, dar una mejor acogida a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Estela is 32 and the single mother of two. She lives with her mother, who took Estela in and helps Estela a lot. Estela studied cosmetology as her home became her beauty salon, where she provides haircutting, manicures, pedicures and other services. She has been doing this work all day for four years. What she likes about the work is that the people who come to her leave her shop feeling satisfied with her work, and she really likes talking with her clients. The problem so far is that she does not have adequate premises. Estela wants to have a building constructed on part of her property for her salon so that she can give her clients a better welcome.

Translated from Spanish by ian harvey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Constructing a better location for her beauty salon

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
Esta señora tiene un negocio de pulpería, inició vendiendo refrescos y helados, luego probó con otros productos como gaseosa y vio que ella podía producir para aportar a los gastos de la casa, pues su esposo no podía con todos los gastos y los niños son estudiantes y tenían gastos .Pensando esto decidió vender otros productos y así ella llego a tener la pulpería que hasta hoy tiene y que está ubicada en la carretera panamericana con rótulo grande para vender a los viajeros de la carretera. 

Decidió obtener un crédito con ADIM y así ofreció más variedad de product6os a los clientes, así ella con todos los financiamientos ha mejorado en la presentación del local que al día de hoy tiene un espacio seguro y a la par su calidad de vida para la familia. 

Está satisfecha con haber logrado salir a delante por su familia y sentir que es empresaria que puede seguir creciendo.
texts.en:
Rosa runs a convenience store. She started out selling beverages and ice cream, then added other products like soft drinks and saw that she was able to help with household expenses; her husband couldn't afford them all on his own and their children are in school. With this in mind, she started selling more products and now has her store located on the Panamerican Highway with a big sign to attract travelers. She decide to obtain a loan through Kiva partner ADIM so she could offer a wider selection of merchandise to her customers, and with all the help, she has been able to improve her store's presentation, making it more secure and improving her family's quality of life at the same time. She's satisfied with having been able to make headway for her family and feels that her business can continue to grow.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise for her convenience store.

loans.name: Lucia Del Carmen

texts.es:
La joven Lucia Del Carmen Laínez A. tiene 25 años su estado civil es casada, ella tiene 2 hijos las edades de sus hijos son de 4 años la niña y el varón de 6 años, el nivel de escolaridad de sus hijos es el siguiente la niña se encuentra en 2 nivel y el niño en 1 grado de primaria, su esposo labora en la alcaldía municipal de león, los deseos que Lucia tiene son de conservar su financiamiento ya que con este tiene la necesidad de ir fortaleciendo y creciendo su negocio de igual manera satisfacer la demanda que sus cliente le proporcionan en su venta otras de las cosas es  ahorrar un poco dinero que tiene para poder darles  a sus hijos una educación en un  futuro ya que estos se encuentran pequeños y  así estaría asegurando sus estudios, también dese poder ir mejorando sus condiciones de vivienda, de esta manera brindarle un poco de condiciones  a su familia.


La actividad económica que ella tiene es una pulpería en la  que vende : golosinas, productos para el hogar y útiles escolares su negocio esta ubicado en león en un barrio llamado san Felipe , inicio su negocio hace 3 años, ya que anteriormente se dedicaba a la comercialización de ropa y cosméticos el cual lo cambio por un negocio fijo   al ver y sentir la necesidad de llevar el sustento de diario  a su hogar teniendo un hijo  que mantener y cuidar, por lo que se decidió montar su pequeño negocio en su casita sin descuidar el negocio primario que dio inicio a dicha actividad, el financiamiento es para capital de trabajo ella desea  aumentar mas su negocio y lograr ser mas competitiva con otras pulperías cercanas.
texts.en:
This young woman, Lucia Del Carmen Laínez A., is 25 years old, married, and has two children, a daughter who is 4 and in level 2 in pre-primary school, and a son who is 6 and in the first grade in primary school. Lucia’s husband works for the municipality of León. One way Lucia will use financing is to strengthen and build her business in a way that will satisfy the demands of her clientele. She also wants to save a little money to give her children an education now while they are little and to assure that they can continue their studies. She would also like to improve the condition of her house.

Her business is a “pulperia” (a convenience store) in which she sells candies, products for the home, and school supplies. Her store is located in León in a neighborhood called San Felipe and she opened it 3 years ago. Before that she had dedicated herself to marketing clothing and cosmetics, but seeing the necessity of earning a steady income to meet daily needs, she decided to make a change. Since she had a young son, she decided to work from home so that she could look after him. This financing will provide the working capital Lucia needs for expanding her business to be competitive with other pulperias nearby.

Translated from Spanish by Melissa Hays, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buy cereal from the rural areas and sell them in town

loans.name: Fizuli

texts.en:
Fizuli Q. is a 45-year-old trader who has sold fruits and vegetables in his own store since 2000. He is married and has one son. From the income he earned during the last eight years, he was able to build his store last year. His store is located in a place where many people pass during the day.

Fizuli wishes to provide to his son an excellent education, but for this purpose he needs more additional funds to increase the number of goods he sells. For this purpose he applied for 1200 USD. This loan he will use to purchase more fruits and vegetables.

loans.use: Purchase more inventory

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Mambo from Tanzania! Jane M. is 38 years old and from Mwanza. She is married with two children who are 6 and 10 years old. Additionally, she is responsible for supporting two dependants whose parents cannot care for them.

Jane has been running a stationary business since 2003. She has demonstrated her business savvy by placing her stationary shops, stalls and tables strategically close to post offices, bookstores, schools and universities. She works at the business for 8 hours per day, 6 days per week. She is assisted by one employee. Jane currently earns about $300 USD from her business per month. She is requesting a loan of $400 USD in order to buy stationary equipment like a scanner, computers and a printer. In the future, she plans to open a new stationary store. Jane thanks you for your support!

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of micro leasing is that it allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To buy stationary equipment like a scanner, computers and a printer

loans.name: Jurabek

texts.ru: Наботов Джурабек житель района Рудаки. Возраст 43 года, женат и имеет четверых детей. Работает таксистом. Кроме того имеет маленький магазинчик , где торгует продуктами питания. Кредит планирует получить для того, чтобы увеличить товарооборот. Товра привозит из города Душанбе, покупая у оптовых реализаторов. Погасиьть кредит сможет в течение 12 месцев.
texts.en:
Jurabek N. lives in Rudaky region. He is 43, married and has 4 children. Jurabek drives a taxi. In addition, he owns a small food store. Jurabek N. applied for this loan to increase the volume of goods sold. He will repay the loan within 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Aleksandr Zhuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase the sales volume

loans.name: Thi My

texts.vi: Chị Đỗ Thị Mý  năm nay 27 tuổi, . Chị tham gia Quỹ tình thương  từ năm 2000. Hiêệntịa công việc đem alị thu nhập chính cho gia đình chị là từ chăn nuôi lợn gà, làm đậu phụ và tiền công làm thợ hàn xì của chồng. Các dự án tăng thu nhập củag ia đình chị đang phát triển tốt và cho thu nhập 6.000.000đ/ tháng.  Vòng vốn tới chị mong muốn được vay 10.000.000đ một phần chị sử dụng để mua thêm lợn về nuôi, phần còn lại chị sẽ sử dụng để mua thêm nguyên liệu phục vụ cho công việc làm đậu phụ của gia đình.
texts.en:
Mrs. D. Thi My, 27 years old, joined the TYM Fund in 2000. Currently, the main source of income for her family comes from raising livestock, making tofu, and her husband's wage from oxyacetylene welding. Her projects to increase income have been going well, yelding an average monthly income of 6 millions VND. This time, she would like to borrow 10 millions VND, partly to purchase more pigs to rear, partly to purchase ingredients to make tofu.

Translated from Vietnamese by Yen Thanh Pham, Kiva Volunteer

video.title: Do Thi - Kiva entrepreneur from  Viet Nam

loans.use: Purchasing tofu ingredients

loans.name: Yawa

texts.fr: Née en 1985 à Hahotoé, Mme Yawa N. est mariée avec trois (03) personnes en charge. Par faute de soutien financier, elle a vite abandonné les études pour se consacrer à l’agriculture (légume, maïs). Afin d’augmenter son revenu, elle sollicite un financement pour agrandir sa surface cultivable et acheter des intrants. Avec les revenus de son activité elle pourra améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille et mieux se prendre en charge.
texts.en:
Born in 1985 in Hahotoé, Yawa N. is married and has three dependents. Due to a lack of money, she left school early to farm vegetables and corn. In order to increase her revenues, she is asking for a loan to increase the area she has under cultivation and to buy inputs. With the revenues from her farming she will be able to improve her family's living conditions and take better care of herself.

Translated from French by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy soil inputs and increase the area she has under cultivation

loans.name: Sok

texts.en:
Sok K., age 26, has been farming for a long time. She owns farmland that she inherited from her grandmother to grow crops. She is married and has three young children who are enrolled in school. Her husband helps her in the farming business.

K. wants a loan to buy a cow and raise its offspring. The family lives in Pursat Province.

loans.use: To purchase a cow

loans.name: Kelly

texts.es: Kelly es una mujer muy comprometida con sus roles como madre y esposa, pues trata de brindar lo mejor de sí, y a pesar de vivir en la casa de sus padres no deja de tener el anhelo de, algún día, adquirir su casa propia. Desde hace 10 años está dedicada a la venta de comida, lo cual realiza en la puerta de su casa, todos los días desde las seis de la tarde hasta las once de la noche, pues sus clientes son sus vecinos, quienes retornan a sus hogares por las noches deseando consumir algunos gustitos y aperitivos que doña Kelly prepara. Sin embargo, esta actividad suele ser peligrosa los fines de semana, por las fiestas que se realizan, lo cual trae granes ganancias, pero se arriesga a que algunos ladrones puedan asaltarla, es por ello que desea instalar un restaurante en la casa de sus padres para dejar de trabajar por las noches y dedicarse en las mañanas a preparar diversos platillos que vendería en el transcurso del día. El tiempo que tiene en MFP es de 3 años, época de nuevos retos, ya que su grupo es muy exigente frente al pago puntual de los créditos. Los 1000 soles solicitados la ayudaran para invertir en la compra de utensilios que requiere para atender a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Kelly is a woman who is very dedicated to her roles as a mother and a wife. She tries to give her best. Although she lives in her parents' house, she doesn't give up on the dream of some day having her own home. For ten years she has sold meals, which she does in front of her home every day from 6:00-11:00 p.m. Her customers are her neighbors, who come over hoping to eat something that Kelly has made. Her job tends to be dangerous on the weekends due to the parties that happen. She earns a lot of profit, but she risks being robbed by thieves. This is why she hopes to put a restaurant in her parents' house so she can stop working at night and prepare food in the morning that she can sell throughout the day. In the time that she has worked with Microfinanzas Prisma, it has been a period of new challenges because her group is very demanding about making punctual payments. The 1,000 PEN that she is requesting will help her invest in the purchase of utensils that she needs to attend to her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Puchase of utensils for her business

loans.name: Olajumoke

texts.en: Olajumoke is 30 years old and married with three children. She styles hair and sells hair extensions, creams, and women's wares. She started this business eight years ago. She hopes for the loan amount of 80,000 Nigerian Naira to purchase more hair extensions to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: For more hair extensions to sell

loans.name: Lorema

texts.en:
Lorema A. is from the town of Aloran, Misamis Occidental. She is 63 years old. Lorema is widowed and has 3 adult-aged children. To make a living, Lorema owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector, selling cosmetics and home products including flowers. While this is not her only means of generating revenue, it is the main source of income from her business, which she sells to the local community. Lorema has been in this business for over 5 years and earns approximately Php5000 a month from her sales.

In 2000, Lorema joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Lorema has successfully repaid previous loans from PMPC. Lorema is requesting a new loan of Php14,900, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the 26th loan Lorema has received from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from her business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

loans.use: Purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary B. is a mother of five children, two sons and three daughters, who are all currently in school – senior high, junior high and primary schools. She is thirty-nine years old and married. She lives with her children and husband in a rented apartment in Dwenase, a suburb of Sefwi-Wiawso in the Western Region of Ghana. Her husband is a tailor by profession.

Mary trades in bags of salt. She supplies them to retailers and food vendors in her community. She also sells under a shed-roof in the market square and treks to other towns to sell on their market days. Mary buys bags of salt from the distributors. She has been in business for two years and wants a loan to buy bags of salt in bulk. She desires to expand her business and give her children the best education she can afford.

loans.use: To buy bags of salt

loans.name: Umri

texts.ru:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”
      “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan. 


 Умри Самадова  1958 года рождения, замужем имеет 5 детей. Имеет среднее образование. Торгует на рынке оптом одеждой. Первый кредит получила в 2003 году на покупку фруктов и овощей. Но 2 года назад изза суровой  зимы  все продукты замерзли и она потеряла  свой товар.  И поэтому перешла на торговлю одежду.  Ей нравиться торговать женской одеждой. Кредит получает на  покупку летней одежды.
texts.en:
Umri S. was born in 1958. She is married and has five children. She has a secondary school education. She trades in clothing on the wholesale market . She received her first loan in 2003 to purchase fruits and vegetables. But two years ago due to a harsh winter, all her goods were frozen and she lost her stock. She therefore proceeded to trade in clothing. She likes selling women's clothing. She would like to take out a loan to purchase summerwear.

Translated from Russian by Josh Machleder, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of women's summer clothing

loans.name: Agustina De La Concepcion

texts.es: Agustina de la Concepción Pérez es cliente de Fundación León 2000, es una mujer casada. Tiene 3 hijos a su cargo que todavía dependen de ella. El espíritu emprendedor y trabajador de Agustina es lo mejor para ella, pues fue por medio de esas fuerzas que el motivo para  establecer la actividad económica como es bar y comedor. Hace más de 25 años que se dedica a este negocio, su negocio está ubicado en el sector de las peñitas, por lo que ofrece muy buena comida y ambiente acogedor. Por lo que sus hijos le ayudan en la atención al cliente. El motivo del financiamiento es para capital de trabajo para la compra de granos básicos, verduras, carnes, gaseosas, jugos y refrescos naturales. Por lo que el sueño de Agustina es brindarle a su familia las condiciones adecuadas de vida.
texts.en:
Agustina de la Concepción Pérez is a client of Fundación León 2000. She is married and has 3 dependent children. Agustina's hardworking, entrepreneurial spirt has helped her most; it was these strengths that motivated her to start her bar and diner. It has been more than 25 years since she dedicated herself to this business. It is located in the Las Peñitas sector, and offers good food and a welcoming atmosphere. Her children help her attend to her customers. Her motive for seeking financing is to have work capital for the purchase of staple grains, vegetables, meat, soda, juice and fresh-squeezed fruit juice. Agustina's dream is to provide her family with a good quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Vivian Lu, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Simona Esperanza

texts.es:
En el departamento de León, en Nicaragua la señora Simona M. desde hace 20 años se ha dedicado a trabajar en la venta de cosméticos siendo comercializados por ella misma en su establecimiento y ofreciendo todo tipo de cosméticos como shampoo, fragancias, perfumes, pinturas de uña, aretes, entre otros. 

Todos estos productos son requeridos  comprarlos para ofertarlos en su negocio y por ello ha acudido a Ceprodel para solicitar dicho crédito y así continuar mejorando su situación económica y llevando el sustento a su casa de habitación.
texts.en:
In district of León in Nicaragua, Sra. Simona M. has been selling cosmetics for 20 years. She offers all types of beauty care products from her vending location such as shampoos, perfumes, nail polishes, etc. She also sells earrings and other costume jewelry.

Today Sra. Simona has come to CEPRODEL to request a loan to purchase the required products needed to restock her business. This will help her continue improving her financial situation and maintain her household.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase cosmetics

loans.name: Gulmira's Group

texts.en:
39-year-old Gulmira R. has three children. Her eldest son, 17, lives in a village with his grandmother. Her second son is 15 and her daughter is just four and half years old. Her and her husband hold interesting occupations as toastmasters in various feasts and banquets during weekends. Previously, her husband used to work in an entertainment centre; now he is an art director in a vocational school. 

They have already taught the basics of their occupation to their middle son. Now he occasionally assists them during banquets. They enjoy doing their job because it provides an income and gives them a lot of free time during the week. Saving little by little, they have able to buy audio equipment and speakers. They understand to survive the competition they constantly have to seek ways to improve the quality of their services. Gulmira hopes to obtain a loan to buy a video camera as it has become essential to organize feasts and parties. In the near future, they plan to organize a band and buy sound equipment for their son so that he is able to work separately. 

Gumira has three loan partners: Gulsaira, Zinagul and Maria. Gulsaira, 42, is a widow with two children. Since the collapse of Soviet Union she has been engaged in commerce near a hospital. Now she plans to sell foodstuffs at school. She needs a loan to purchase goods and foodstuffs in order to increase turnover. With the return, she would pay for her daughter’s education. 

Zinagul, 44, is a mother of five children. Besides being a housewife, she helps her husband raise the livestock. Zinagul needs a loan to buy a milk cow in order to sell milk.

Maria, 50, is married and has six children. Her husband and son raise cattle while she manufactures traditional articles. In her spare time, she helps her husband look after cattle. Maria wants to obtain a loan to open up a shop as there are few of them in the area.
 
  ======================================
--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan.

Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development on the basis of 3-Ps concept - People (building human capital and taking care of its customers and the society as well), Profit (to be profitable to grow further) and the Planet (taking care of the environment). It is also the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan who delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan - at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and Mol Bulak staff.

loans.use: To buy a video camera

loans.name: Gladys

texts.es:
Gladys es socia del Banco Comunal Alianza.
Gladys es soltera, tiene 44 años y 1 hijo, Gladys tiene un molino de grano en su casa ubicado en una avenida concurrida, en donde brinda los servicios de molienda y también procesa cereales que vende en los mercados.
Gladys necesita un préstamo de 1400 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de trigo, cebada y quinua.
Los sueños de Gladys son ampliar sus negocios, su hijo culmine sus estudios y tener un restaurante.
texts.en:
Gladys is a member of the Alianza Microfinance Institute.

Gladys is a 44-year-old single mother with 1 son. She has a mill in her house, which is located on a bustling street. She provides grinding services, as well as processes grains, which she then sells at several markets.

Gladys needs a 1,400.00 PEN loan, which will be invested in purchasing wheat, barley and quinoa.

She dreams of expanding her businesses and opening her own restaurant. She also hopes to see her son complete his studies.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase wheat, barley and quinoa

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of motor oil

loans.name: Comfort

texts.en:
Comfort sells local herbs. She prepares the herbs from roots and bark of trees mixed with some other ingredients. She sells from a van at the local market square, and she also treks to other towns to sell on their market days. She also supplies drug stores in her community. Comfort has been in business for four years and wants a loan to buy herbs and other ingredients in bulk.

Comfort is 40 years old, married and has three children who are all in school. She lives with her children and husband in a rented apartment in Goaso, a busy commercial and farming community in the Brong Ahafo region.

loans.use: To buy herbs

loans.name: Edlene

texts.en:
Edlene S. is from the village of Kingay Norte, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She is 27 years old, is married, and has two school-aged children.

Edlene owns and operates a specialized retail store, selling products such as glasses,cellphone accessories watches, etc., in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over a year and earns approximately 8,000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Edlene joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 15,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be her first from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 


About GDMPC:
GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.


 *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Annabelle

texts.en:
Annabelle M. is from the village of Nacional Jimenez Mis. Occ. She is 31 years old. Annabelle is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Annabelle owns & operates a general store selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap & toothpaste in the local community. Annabelle has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Annabelle joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Annabelle has successfully repaid a previous loan of 15,000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Annabelle is requesting a new loan of 25,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Annabelle from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Ban

texts.en: Ban S. is a 32-year-old woman and lives with her own family in Phnom Penh city. Ban S. is a good housewife who cooks delicious meals for her family. She now takes care of four school-aged children, while her husband named Seang Sothea, age 34, works in a military department. Since the mature rice season is coming, Ban S. is looking for a US$ 1200 loan to use as capital to order mature rice in bulk from farmers during the time when rice commands the cheapest price. She will sell it for a profit when the rice is at its highest cost.

loans.use: To order mature rice in bulk from farmers when rice commands the cheapest price

loans.name: Dominga

texts.es:
La señora Dominga es socia del Banco Comunal “Lupakas” desD. hace 3 años atrás, del distrito D. Pilcuyo, provincia D. El Collao, departamento D. Puno. Ella tiene 64 años D. edad, es viuda y tiene 5 hijos. Estudió secundaria completa y se dedica a la compra y venta D. sogas.
Dominga nos cuenta que con el primer préstamo solicitado al Movimiento Manuela Ramos que fue D. S/. 300.00 nuevos soles pudo aumentar su capital.
Ella solicitará un crédito D. S/. 1,000.00 nuevos soles con el que podrá comprar lana, hilos y nylon para elaborar las sogas.
Su sueño para el futuro es vivir tranquila en compañía D. sus nietos y seguir trabajando.
Lo que más le gusta D. su Banco Comunal es el ahorro y las reuniones con las socias.
texts.en:
Dominga has been a member of "Lupakas" communal bank for three years, in the Pilcuyo district, El Collao province, state of Puno. She is 64 years old, widowed, and has 5 children. She completed her secondary education and buys and sells ropes. Dominga tells us that the first loan she took out from the Manual Ramos Movement was for 300 soles to increase her capital. She is requesting a loan of 1,000 soles which she will use to purchase wool, thread, and nylon to make rope. Her dream for the future is to live peacefully with her grandchildren and continue working. What she likes best about her communal bank are the savings and the member meetings.

Translated from Spanish by Michele Magrino, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of wool, thread, nylon

loans.name: Sokhom

texts.en:
Mr. Sokhom R. (pictured here), 40 and his wife, Mrs. Sothea Morn, 41, live on an Island in the Mekong River about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia. They have been married since 1990 and have five children: four sons and one daughter. All of them are in school. 
 
Sokhom has been a builder for five years. His wife is a farmer. He hopes to supplement another business raising pigs and producing rice wine. He will be able to earn more income to support his family. When he is free, he also assists his wife in her farming business.

Sokhom is asking for a loan of $1,000 to use for his pig-raising and wine-producing businesses.

loans.use: To purchase piglets and buy materials to  produce rice wine.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn M. is from the village of Malipayon, Pangantucan Bukidnon. Jocelyn is married and has 5 school-aged children. To make a living, Jocelyn owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. The main source of income for the business comes from selling both food & daily use products in the local community. Jocelyn has been engaged in her business for over 8 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Jocelyn joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jocelyn has successfully repaid a previous loan of 14,000 PHP from HSPFI. Jocelyn is requesting same loan amount of 14,000 PHP which will be used to invest in renovating the business. This will be the 5th loan taken out by Jocelyn from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in renovating the business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To install flooring.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth E. is single and has three children. She has no educational background. Elizabeth bakes bread to sell in Elmina. She has been doing this for some time now. Elizabeth uses her income to pay school fees and utility bills. 

Elizabeth will use the loan to purchase more flour, margarine, oil and ingredients for sale. With the new profits from her expanded business, Elizabeth plans to save to educate her children and to buy land for her family.

loans.use: To purchase more flour, margarine, oil and ingredients

loans.name: Bunmi

texts.en:
Bunmi F. is 40 years old and is married with four children. She lives in Ogbomoso, Oyo State, Nigeria. Her husband works to support their home.

Bunmi is a hardworking woman. She sells for long hours to enable her to support her husband. She sells groceries at retail prices to her customers and has been in this business for five years. She hopes for a loan of NGN 50,000 to purchase more groceries to sell.

Bunmi hopes to own a supermarket and expand her business in the future. She says thanks to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more groceries to sell

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary sells frozen fish at retail prices to her customers. She sells her frozen fish in the market in Benin City, Edo State. Mary is really itching for significant expansion in her business; she needs a loan of NGN 80,000 to purchase more iced fish to sell.

Mary is 43 years old and is a hardworking woman. She is married with six children. Her children are doing well at school and this gives her joy. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more frozen fish to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more groceries to sell

loans.name: Proloung

texts.en: Mr. Proloung Y., 35 years old, is a villager who lives in Popeal Kher IDL village in Kandal province. He is an iron welder and his wife, Mrs. Vanny Sorn, is a vegetable seller. With these two businesses, they can earn a small income to support their family. They now face a problem because their house needs to be repaired. Thus, Mr. Proloung Y. decided to ask for a loan to fix up his house. This couple has two children; one is attending in a local school while the younger one is 4 years old. Her husband is also in the picture.

loans.use: to fix up his house

loans.name: Felipe

texts.en:
Felipe A. is from the village of Punta, Pana-on, Misamis Occidental. He is 58 years old, married, and has four adult-aged children. To make a living, Felipe owns and operates a business providing transportation services to local community members. Felipe has been engaged in his business for over a year and earns approximately 3,000 PHP per month from these activities.
In 2010, Felipe joined Kiva partner, GDMPC, to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. He is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to repair a transport vehicle used in the business. This loan will be his first from GDMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve his family's living conditions.

About GDMPC
GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To repair a transport vehicle used in the business

loans.name: Nelson Gustavo

texts.es:
El Sr. Nelson G. de 49 años de edad, es viudo su esposa fallecio hace 1 año, tiene 2 hijas ya señoritas, es mecanico desde muy joven, tiene un taller de reparación y manteniemiento de motocicletas de todas las marcas y modelos, gracias a este trabajo pudo mantener y educar a sus hijas.
El Sr Nelson tiene su taller en su domicilio ubicado en el barrio Azucena de Cnel. Oviedo, donde ademas de las reparaciones de motos de sus clientes,  realiza manteniemiento  por garantias de una empresa de venta de motos reconocida del paiscual es Chacomer.
Solicito apoyo crediticio a la Fundación para la compra de aceite, filtros, corona, cadena, cubiertas, camaras, herramientas, etc para su taller, y asi poder seguir ofreciendo a su amplia clientela un servicio rapido y efectivo.
El Sr Nelson agradece a la Fundacion Paraguaya y a Kiva por el apoyo recibido.
texts.en:
Nelson G., 49, is a widower whose wife died a year ago. He has two grown daughters. He has been working as a mechanic since the time he was very young. He has a workshop where he repairs and maintains motorcycles of all models and brands. Thanks to this work he was able to support and educate his daughters. Nelson has his workshop in his home, located in the Azucena neighborhood of Coronel Oviedo. There, in addition to the repairs he makes to the motorcycles of his customers, he also performs warranty repairs for Chacomer, a company that sells motorcycles and is well-known in the country. He requests this loan from the Fundación to buy oil, filters, sprockets, chains, inner tubes, tools, etc. for his workshop. In this way he can continue to offer his large clientele rapid and effective service. Nelson is grateful to the Fundacion Paraguaya and Kiva for the support he has received.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy tools, headlights, motor oil, spark plugs, etc.

loans.name: Rochell Liza

texts.en:
Rochell Liza G., a 27-year-old single woman from the city of Prenza Tangub, owns and operates a specialized retail store selling a variety of products such as biscuits, noodles, sugar, salt, vinegar, cooking oil, etc. Engaged in her business for over three years, she earns approximately 6000 PHP a month.

In 2010, Rochell Liza joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Now requesting a loan of 5000 PHP to invest in expanding the business, she plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partners to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Ghulaam Fatima's Group

texts.en:
Ghulaam Fatima lives in the city of Vehari with her husband and family. She has four children, three daughters and a son. One of them is getting her education. Her husband is a laborer and she sells clothes to cover the basic needs of her family. She purchases the clothes from Faisalabad and sells them to different shops in Vehari to earn income. 

She is applying for a loan from Asasah to invest in her business. She will buy more varieties of clothes to offer to her clients. She thinks that by adding variety to her business, she can earn more income that will help her family to live a better life. 

Note: In this picture Rukshana, one group member, is showing her bread-making business.

loans.use: Purchase clothes for resale

loans.name: Vy´a Renda Group

texts.es:
Las integrantes del Comité Vy´a Renda son señoras muy activas y trabajadoras quienes procuran mucho para salir adelante realizando diversos trabajo para mejorar los ingresos de la familia.
Así una de las integrantes es la señora Carmen quien  trabaja como empleada domestica en una casa de familia por la mañana y por la tarde se dedica a la elaboración de de dulce caseros.
Ella elabora dulce de distintos tipos de dulces que posteriormente ella vende a varios negocios de la zona.
Solicita el prestamos para la compra de ingrediente para elaborar dulces como: azúcar, frutas, miel, y otros.
texts.en:
The members of the "Vy´a Renda" Group are women who are very active and hard-working. Through a variety of work, they strive to get ahead in order to improve their family's earnings. For instance, one of the members is Ms. Carmen, who is a domestic worker at a family's house in the mornings, and works making homemade sweets in the afternoons. She makes several different types of sweets, which she then sells to various businesses in the area. She is requesting this loan to purchase ingredients for making her sweets, such as: sugar, fruits, honey, and other ingredients.

Translated from Spanish by Katie Kavanagh, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fruits, sugar, honey, and other ingredients for making sweets

loans.name: Meivi

texts.en:
Meivi L. is 44 and married with six children. She owns a business venture selling pancakes (fried flour pancakes flavored with lemon or coconut jam). She has one year of experience in this business. Meivi needs a loan of 1,000 WST to buy flour, flavoring, sugar and plastic bags. She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 100 WST per week) to improve and expand her business.
In 2010, Meivi joined Kiva partner, SPBD. This is her first loan with SPBD. SPBD's loans are Meivi's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks.

About SPBD
In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD and, since then, it has expanded from the main island of Upolu in Samoa to Savaii as well as Tonga. SPBD's philosophy of lending is based upon the Grameen Bank lending method. Please join SPBD's lending team on Kiva to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD. Visit http://www.kiva.org/community/viewTeam?team_id=8375

loans.use: To buy flour, flavoring, sugar and plastic bags

loans.name: Domingo Jr.

texts.en:
Domingo Jr. P. is from the village of Centro Sur, Alcala, Cagayan. He is 31 years old. Domingo Jr. is married and has an infant child. To make a living, Domingo Jr. operates a transportation business. The main source of income for the business comes from providing motorcycle-transport services to local community members. Domingo Jr. has been engaged in his business for over three years and earns approximately 2,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month from it.

In 2010, Domingo Jr. joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Domingo Jr. has successfully repaid a previous loan from ASKI. Domingo Jr. is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase materials needed to expand services provided. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of his family. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase materials needed to expand services provided

loans.name: Gustavo Adolfo

texts.es: El Sr. Gustavo Adolfo F. S. es trabajador activo del  Hotel Barceló Monte limar tiene  ocho  años de trabajarle a esta institución desempeñándose como Electricista. Ha tenido  seis créditos con CEPRODEL y cada uno lo ha hecho para comprar materiales de construcción y mejorar su casa de habitación los créditos le han beneficiado en gran manera ya que de esta manera él ha  mejorado su condición de vida de él y su familia.
texts.en:
Mr. Gustavo Adolfo F. S. has been employed by the Barceló Montelimar Hotel as an electrician for the last 8 years. CEPRODEL has granted him six loans that have been used to buy building materials and supplies for home improvements. The loans have been of great benefit to him in that they have helped improve his and his family’s living conditions.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy building materials and supplies: cement, sand, gravel, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buy a computer

loans.name: Leo

texts.en:
Leo S. is 34 years old, married and has one school-aged child. He is from the village of Poblacion, a part of Mambajao municipality in Camiguin province on the Mindanao islands. Leo provides motorela (a three-wheeled vehicle powered by a motorcycle) and habal-habal (motorcycle) services to local community members. Leo has been engaged in his business for over four years and earns approximately 9000 PHP a month.

In 2010, Leo joined HSPFI to gain access to its financial services. Leo is requesting a loan, his first, of 5000 PHP that will be used to purchase materials needed for the maintenance of his service vehicles. He plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve his business.

About HSPFI:

Hagdan sa Pag-uswag Foundation, Inc., or HSPFI, is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that one-on-one translations of entrepreneur profiles are costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow it to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase materials needed for the maintenance of his service vehicles

loans.name: Matar

texts.fr: Monsieur Matar S.  est un marié de 36 ans qui habite à Yoff. Il est marié et père de 4 enfants dont l’âge  varie entre 2 et 10 ans. Monsieur S. est actuellement commis de chambre a l’hôtel  Ngor Diarama  par l’intermédiaire d’une de ses sœurs qui l’a recommandé .Mais auparavant il a exercé l’activité de pêche.  L’objectif  visé par Monsieur S. est  d’être  actif et de  gagner sa vie à travers la qualité de son travail. Il est membre de la caisse de Yoff depuis janvier 2007. Il sollicite un crédit de 100 000 frs prévu pour la réfection de s a maison maternelle afin d’améliorer le cadre de vie familial.
texts.en:
Mr. Matar S. is a 36-year-old man who lives in Yoff. He is married and has four children whose ages range from 2 to 10 years old. 

Mr. S. currently works as a clerk at the Ngor Diarama hotel following a recommendation by one of his sisters. Previously, he had been a fisherman. 

Mr. S.’s goal is to remain active and earn a living through the quality of his work. He has been a member of Yoff credit union since January 2007. He is requesting a loan of 100,000 francs to repair his maternal home and improve living conditions.

loans.use: Home repairs

loans.name: Darling Celeste

texts.es:
La Sra. Darling Celeste S. G. es comerciante del Mercado central, ella vende pepena, frito, carne de cerdo, hueso, etc. 
Esta señora tiene 15 años de experiencia en este negocio y es un excelentísimo clienta, muy responsable con sus obligaciones.
A la fecha lleva 31 créditos con CEPRODEL,  y siempre ha cumplido, esta señora dice sentirse muy agradecida con la Institución por todo el apoyo que le han brindado.
texts.en:
Mrs. Darling Celeste S. G. is a merchant in the Central Market.  She sells offal, fried pork skins, pork, bones, etc.

She has 15 years experience in this business and she is a most excellent client; she is very responsible with her commitments.

To date she has had 31 CEPRODEL loans and has always repaid.  She says that she is very grateful with the Institution for all the support it’s given her.

loans.use: To buy live pigs for butchering.

loans.name: Melver

texts.es: Melver, de 19 años, es un joven con muchas ambiciones, vive en la capital del país, ahí estudia para poder ser aceptado en una universidad. Pero los fines de semana visita a sus padres, que residen en la zona rural de Tapo (sierra del Perú). A su corta edad él apoya a sus padres e invierte en su futuro. Hace algunos años, sus padres le dieron la confianza de poder sembrar en los terrenos que le dieron de herencia, desde entonces  siembra papa, en grandes cantidades, con la ayuda de peones y la asesoría de su padre, logrando así generarse un pequeño capital. Pero como sus aspiraciones son estudiar Ingeniería Agroindustrial, en la capital, decidió, comenzar a estudiar para poder ser aceptado en una universidad, pero sin descuidar de su cultivo, ahora él, no solo los comercializa en el mercado central de su ciudad, sino también en el mercado de abastos de la capital, donde descubrió que, puede adquirir mayores ganancias. Ahora Melver, está dedicado íntegramente a cumplir su objetivo y retribuir el apoyo que le ofreció su familia. Es el tercer crédito con MFP y agradece el apoyo que le ofrece su banco comunal, en estos momentos de superación y construcción de objetivos. Con el crédito que obtendrá, podrá comprar abono para su producción de papa, que dentro de algunos meses cosechará.
texts.en:
Melver, at 19 years of age, is a young man with many ambitions.  He lives in the capital of the country where he studied to be accepted in the university.  But on weekends, he visits his parents who reside in the rural zone of Tapo (in Peru's mountains).  At his young age he helps his parents and invests in his future.

Some years ago, his parents instilled in him the confidence to be able to cultivate lands he received as an inheritance.  Since then, he has sown potatoes in large quantities, with the help of day laborers and the advice of his father, thus acquiring a small amount of capital.

But since Melver's aspirations are to study agro-industrial engineering in the capital, he decided to study hard in order to be accepted in the university, while not neglecting his farm.  Now, he not only sells in the local central market, but also in the main market of the capital, where he discovered that he could obtain larger earnings.  Now Melver is entirely dedicated to reaching his objectives and paying back the assistance offered by his family.
