While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. IMON's History Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low-income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing seeds, fertilizer and young cattle in order to expand the business

loans.name: Margarita

texts.es:
Margarita resiD. en Santiago D. María, departamento D. Usulután,  tiene 48 años D. edad, es una comerciante D. verduras y frutas; vive con su esposo y sus dos hijos D. las edades D. 18 y 24 años.
Ella inicio el negocio desD. hace 12 años por iniciativa propia, atendiéndolo desD. las 7:30 D. la mañana hasta 4:30 D. la tarD. en el mercado municipal D. Santiago D. María. Margarita desea invertir en su negocio para ello solicita un préstamo que le ayuD. a obtener más verduras y frutas para la venta, como tomates, chiles, papas, cebollas, piñas, bananos, melones entre otros que le son demandados por los clientes. Con este préstamo fortalecerá el puesto D. venta atenderá mejor a las personas que transitan por el mercado en busca D. estos productos.
Su trabajo lo desea mejorar cada día, el servicio al cliente, el ofrecer productos frescos, para generar ingresos que le den estabilidad a su hogar y mejorar la condición D. vida con la que cuentan.
texts.en:
Margarita, 48, lives in Santiago D. María, Usulután department.  She is a fruit and vegetable merchant.  She lives with her husband and two children who are 18 and 24 years old.

She started the business on her own 12 years ago.  She is open for business from 7:30am until 4:30pm in Santiago D. María’s Municipal Market.  Margarita wants to invest in her business so is asking for a loan that will help her obtain more vegetables and fruit to sell like, tomatoes, chilies, potatoes, onion, pineapples, plantains and melons, among others, that her customers ask for.  The loan will strengthen her sales stand so that she can better tend to people who wander through the market in search of these products.

She wants to improve her business and customer service every day, offering fresh products to generate income that will proviD. stability to her home and improve their living conditions.

loans.use: To buy vegetables and fruit.

loans.name: Victorino Mercedes

texts.es:
VICTORINO MERCEDES, 5.	El trabaja como Vigilante en el del Centro de Formación Profesional Nicaragüense Holandés Simón Bolívar.
es padre de familia de dos hijos y estos se encuentran en edad escolar, el prestamos solicitado es para invertir en algunas mejoras que va hacerle a su casa de habitacion.
texts.en:
Victorino Mercedes, 5, works as a watchman at the Simón Bolívar Nicaraguan-Dutch Center for Professional Development.

He is the father of a family with two school-age children.  He will use the requested loan to invest in some improvements that he would like to make to his home.

loans.use: to buy construction materials to replace the roof on his house

loans.name: Agustin

texts.es: El señor Agustín se dedica a la carpintería, en algunas ocasiones trabaja con contratos grandes que le toman tres a seis meses terminarlos como fabricación de muebles empotrados, marcos de ventanas, puertas, etc. En edificios y hoteles. También trabaja en casas particulares barnizando puertas y ventanas. Don Agustín vive con sus tres hijos en una zona alejada de la ciudad de La Paz, con mucho esfuerzo él y su esposa compraron un terreno donde construyeron su domicilio, ahora se encuentra trabajando en la fabricación de marcos de ventanas hechas de madera cedro, en un futuro don Agustín desea tener todo el equipo necesario porque por el momento alquila parte de la maquinaria con la cual trabaja, de esta manera tener más ingresos y dar un futuro mejor a sus tres hijos. Solicita el crédito para la compra de ladrillos y el pago a la mano de obra para dar mayor comodidad a su familia construyendo más cuartos en su domicilio.
texts.en:
Agustín is a carpenter.  Sometimes he works on big contracts that take three to six months to complete like making built in units, window and door frames, etc. in buildings and hotels.  He also works in private homes varnishing doors and windows.  He is currently working making cedar window frames.

Agustín lives with his three children in an area that’s a distance away from the city of La Paz; he and his wife bought a piece of property with much effort where they built their house.  

Because he currently leases some of the machinery he works with, Agustín wants to eventually own all the necessary equipment so that his income will improve thus providing a better future for his three children.

He is asking for funds to buy bricks and to pay labor costs to build more rooms onto his house thus providing more comfort for his family.

loans.use: To buy building materials and supplies.

loans.name: Maritza

texts.es:
Maritza D. L. es una futura Microempresaria de la comunidad de Canalete de en Alajuela. 
Ella va ser parte de una sociedad de mujeres  que van a conformar la  micro empresa “Creaciones de ensueño” la cual consiste en la confección de ropa de cama, como edredones, sabanas, cobijas, almohadas y cortinas para cuartos. 
Para empezar cada una de ellas debe de aportar su cuota, es por eso que Doña Maritza  necesita un préstamo de  ₡350 000 (trescientos cincuenta mil) para la compra de materiales, telas y maquinas de coser principalmente.
Ella    es socia  de la Empresa de Crédito Comunal Canalete, una de las 100 organizaciones socias de EDESA en Costa Rica.
texts.en:
Maritza D. L. is a future small businesswoman in the Canalete community of Alajuela.

She is going to be part of a group of women who make up the micro business “Creaciones de ensueño” (Creations of dreams) which consists of making bed linens including comforters, sheets, blankets, pillos and curtains for bedrooms.

To begin each day one of the group needs to take her part, and so Maritza needs a loan of ₡350 000 to buy material, fabric, and sewing machines.

She is a member of the Empresa de Crédito Comunal Canalete, one of the 100 member organizations of EDESA in Costa Rica.

loans.use: Buy fabric and sewing machines

loans.name: Sabias Unidas Group

texts.es:
El Grupo Sabias Unidas está conformado por 13 socias, pertenecen al distrito de Yarinacocha, en el Departamento de Ucayali,  este grupo ha visto la manera de acceder al crédito  en forma grupal porque todas  se dedican a la misma actividad, que es  la venta de comida.  Su presidenta es la señora María Cristina Chávez I.,   que como la responsable del grupo está dando el ejemplo a las demás socias de cómo deben invertir en sus negocios.
Con su nuevo préstamo la señora cristina invertirá s/. 100 soles en 25 kg de  arroz, 25 kg azúcar, 6 litros de aceite,  un paquete de fideos,  y condimentos, s/. 50 soles en lo que es carnes, s/. 150 soles en lo que son enseres;  5 jarras de ½ litro, 1 doc. de vasos, 1 doc. de platos, 2 cucharones, 1 espátula, 2 tazones y 2 cuchillos y otros como gas. La señora Cristina tiene hijos en edad escolar y tiene que trabajar para sacarlos adelante.
El Grupo Sabias Unidas, está solicitando un nuevo préstamo de S/. 4,900 soles, distribuido de la sigueinte manera: la señora Sofía H. S/. 500.00 Soles, Iris Reátegui  s/.300.00 soles, Lulú M. S/. 500.00 soles, Carmen C. S/. 300.00 soles, Layli S. S/. 500.00 soles, Marcia C. S/.300.00 soles, Debby T. S/.300.00 soles, Clementina T. S/.300.00 soles, Digna C. S/.500.00 soles, Luz María Q. S/.500.00 soles, Deysi B. S/.300.00 soles, Silvia P. S/.300.00 soles  Este grupo trabaja en forma coordinada con sus socias tiene más de un año trabajando y están logrando mejorar su negocios y por lo mismo mejorar su calidad de vida de toda su familia, con este nuevo prestamos cada una invertirá en la compra de los enseres o insumo que les hace falta y priorizando sus necesidades.

En la foto, algunas socias se muestran con sus hijos.
texts.en:
The group Sabias Unidas is made up of 13 members who belong to the Yarinacocha district in the department of Ucayali. This group has chosen the way to access the loan in group form because they all work in the same activity, which is food sales. Their president is Ms. Maria Cristina C. I. who, as the manager of the group, is giving the example to the other members about how they must invest in their businesses. With her new loan, Cristina will invest 100 soles in 25 kg of rice, 25 kg of sugar, 6 litres of oil, a package of noodles, and condiments; 50 soles in meat; 150 soles in household equipment: 5 jugs of 1/2 litre, 1 dozen cups, 1 dozen plates, 2 ladles, 1 spatula, 2 bowls, and 2 knives and other things like gas. Cristina has school-age children and has to work in order to give them a good education.

The group Sabias Unidas is requesting a new loan of 4,900 soles distributed in the following way: Ms. Sofia H. 500.00 soles, Iris R. 300.00 soles, Lulu M. 500.00 soles, Carmen C. 300.00 soles, Layli S. 500.00 soles, Marcia C. 300.00 soles, Debby T. 300.00 soles, Clementina T. 300.00 soles, Digna C. 500.00 soles, Luz Maria Q. 500.00 soles, Deysi B. 300.00 soles, Silvia P. 300.00 soles. This group works in a coordinated form with its members, and has been doing so for more than a year. They are managing to improve their businesses as well as the quality of life of their entire families. With this new loan, each one will prioritize their needs and invest in the purchase of houshold equipment or supplies that they are lacking.   

In the photo some members are shown with their children.

loans.use: Purchase of supplies

loans.name: Aba

texts.en: Aba A. sells cooked beans and fried ripped plantain, which is commonly called "red red." She also works at a poultry farm, which she runs with her husband at Ankaful near Abura. Aba has received no formal education. She is married and has two children. Her husband is a poultry farmer. Aba has been selling "red red" for 12 years now. She is responsible for assisting her husband in paying for the family's expenses. Her loan will be used to add to their capital to invest in the poultry farm. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to invest back into the poultry farm.

loans.use: Capital for poultry farm

loans.name: Felix

texts.es:
Félix tiene 36 años, es un hombre muy divertido y trabajador, vive en casa propia junto a su esposa Margarita, de 34 años, y sus 5 queridos hijos, a quienes desea brindar una mejor calidad de vida.

La bodega de Félix es la primera en abrir en el poblado de Kimbiri, desde las 5 de la mañana su negocio está listo para recibir a sus madrugadores compradores, quienes sabiendo de la variedad de la mercadería que tiene en su bodega no dudan en comprarle, ya que tienen la seguridad de que van a encontrar las cosas que necesitan.
Lo que más le gusta a Félix de su trabajo es conversar con sus clientes y enterarse de las cosas que suceden en su barrio, lleva 10 años en este negocio y considera que lo más difícil es permanecer todo el día dentro de su tienda, sin poder realizar otras actividades.
Cabe mencionar que tiene un carro, el cual alquila para el servicio de taxi, lo que le da la oportunidad de tener un ingreso extra y ofrecer trabajo a otra persona. Con el tiempo, anhela poder tener otro negocio, con el cual mejore la economía de su familia.

Este es el tercer préstamo de Félix con MFP y espera poder pagarlo a tiempo, ya que no quiere tener problemas con su banco comunal, donde es muy respetado.
Con los dos mil quinientos nuevos soles solicitados comprará repuestos para su carro y más abarrotes para surtir su variada tienda y así brindar una mejor atención a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Felix is 36 years old. He is a very hardworking and fun guy. He lives in his own house with is wife, Margarita (34) and his 5 dear children for whom he wants to provide a better life. 

Felix's shop is the first to open in the town of Kimbiri.  At 5 in the morning his business is ready to receive early bird buyers, who knowing the variety of goods he has in his store do not hesitate to buy, and they are assured that they will find things that they need.

What Felix likes most about his job is talking with customers and learning about things that happen in his neighborhood. He has been in this business for 10 years and believes that the hardest thing is to stay inside his shop all day, unable to do other activities.

It is worth mentioning that he has a car, which he rents for a taxi service. This gives him the opportunity for extra income and offers employment to others. Over time, he wants to have another business, which will improve his family finances.

This is Felix's third loan from MFP and he expects to pay on time, so that he will not have problems in his community bank, where he is very respected. With the money he is requesting, he will buy parts for his car and more groceries to stock his shop to provide better service to his customers.

loans.use: Buy merchandise for his business

loans.name: Enhbayar

texts.en:
Enhbayar, 54, is married and lives with his wife and three daughters in Ulaanbaatar, the capital of Mongolia.  They live in a ger, which is a Mongolian nomadic housing tent.  His oldest daughter and wife help his business while his two younger daughters attend University.  

He started a woodcraft and car repair service businesses in 1999.  He makes wood products which his wife sells at Narantuul, the biggest outdoor market in Ulaanbaatar.  By operating his business he supports his family and pays for the studies of his daughters.  Their living situation is improving little by little.  They have their own land where someday they dream of building a house.  

Enhbayar is a hardworking and humble man who says that he is trying to provide his daughters with an opportunity to get a good education.  He is requesting a loan of 3,000,000 MNT to purchase more wood and material for his woodcraft business.

loans.use: To purchase more wood and material.

loans.name: Bayarsaihan

texts.en:
Bayarsaihan, 42, is married and lives with his wife and two children in Suhbaatar province of Mongolia. His wife is a kindergarden teacher and his older son attends college while younger son goes to a local secondary school. They live in a ger, a Mongolian nomadic housing tent, on a small plot of land that they own. 

Bayarsaihan started a transportation service business in 1992 with a Russian truck. Now he transports coal between local towns in the winter time. In the summer time he transports different shipments depending on the availability. Bayarsaihan is a hardworking and honest person who says, " I am planning to build a house on the land that I own by next year".

He is requesting a loan of 2,500,000 MNT since he is going to buy a new car.

loans.use: To buy a new car

loans.name: Sergio

texts.es: Sergio G. es un joven soltero de 40 años que vive con su mamá y su hermana en uno de los   barrios mas alegres y populares de la ciudad de Barranquilla: Carrizal; allí el se dedica a la fabricación de prendas deportivas como  sudaderas, pantalonetas, camisetas etc.  Su negocio inició cuando trabajando en oficios varios en una microempresa cerca a su casa, donde también en sus tiempos libres ayudaba a confeccionar este tipo de ropa, allí fue donde aprendió este arte y el dueño de la microempresa lo entusiasmó, para que siguiera en esta actividad de manera independiente en la que actualmente  se desempeña, aunque con la estructura física  básica para hacerlo, por eso su sueño es dotarlo de maquinarias industriales, que le generen mayor independencia, porque en la actualidad paga por la elaboración de cada prenda.  Su principal desafío era acceder a financiamiento de las instituciones de crédito pero eso es cosa del pasado, porque  esta aplicando a un credikiva que es su primer crédito con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo y con el cual construirá su historia financiera, así es que lo aprovechará muy bien y comprará  telas e insumos en mayor cantidad con descuentos especiales, con los cuales fabricará sudaderas y pantalonetas al por mayor, inversión que le augura una recuperación de la inversión con sus respectivas utilidades, porque vende sobre pedidos con una calidad   inigualable  y esto es con lo que el realmente compite.
texts.en:
Sergio G. is 40 years of age, single, and lives with his mother and sister in one of the happiest and popular neighbors in the city of Barraquilla, Carrizal. There he manufactures sportswear such as sweatshirts, shorts, T-shirts, and other items. Sergio started in this trade by working different jobs for a small business near his house. In his free time, he also helped produce this type of clothing. This is how he learned the art of sewing. His employer encouraged him to pursue this business independently and now he has his own operation located in a basic structure. Sergio currently dreams of acquiring industrial machines so that he will be more independent because he currently pays to have each garment produced. His main challenge was being able to access funding from credit institutions, but now that is a thing of the past.

Sergio is requesting a Kiva loan, which is his first with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. This will enable him to build a credit history. He will take advantage of this opportunity to buy fabrics and supplies wholesale so that he can get special discounts. These materials will be used to manufacture sweaters and shorts in mass quantities so that he can generate a return on his investment. Sergio sells his goods according to order. He is able to compete in the marketplace due to the unmatched quality of his products.

loans.use: Purchase fabrics & supplies wholesale for manufacturing sportswear

loans.name: Paul

texts.en:
Paul has been practicing mixed farming for fifteen years and employs two farmhands. His farm produces milk, tea and vegetables, which are all sold to the local market. He mainly depends on the income from his farm to cover the needs of his family. Paul is 36 years old and married with three school-aged children who all attend school.

He has requested a loan of 50,000 KES through Juhudi Kilimo to build a dairy unit and purchase a chuff cutter. The extra income from this loan will help improve his family's livelihood. He hopes that in the next five years he will have graduated from a peasant farmer to a large scale farmer.

loans.use: To build a dairy unit and purchase a chuff cutter.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more items to sell to her customers

loans.name: Kop

texts.en:
The woman shown in the picture is Kop F., 63, a dried fish and fresh fish seller. She usually buys fish in bulk from rural areas or from her wholesaler at a reasonable price and then sells them in the busy market. She earns a profit from this business about $5 USD per day. 

Her husband’s name is Soksan; he is 59 and works growing fruit on his own farm. The couple is blessed with ten children, four are single, and five are married. Kop F. will use her loan to build a new kitchen to cook meals for her family.

loans.use: to build a new kitchen to cook meals for her family

loans.name: Hayastan

texts.en:
Hayastan H. is from the village of Arpeni in the Shirak region of Armenia. Even though Hayastan has a university degree as a foreign language teacher; the economic difficulties in the Shirak region have not permitted Hayastan to find a teaching job. In order to provide for her family Hayastan has been a hard working farmer for the past thirty years.  

Hayastan and her husband work on the family farm. They have three children – a twenty-four year old daughter and two sons (thirty-three and thirty-four).  She dreams of having her daughter complete her education, to be able to work and have a family. Hayastan would like a loan to purchase livestock and feed. According to her business plan this investment will increase the family income by thirty percent. Hayastan is pleased with the services of microfinance and looks forward to expanding her business.

loans.use: to purchase livestock and animal feed.

loans.name: Darlita

texts.en:
Darlita Q. is from the village of Taguanao, Indahag, Cagayan de Oro City. She is 56 years old. Darlita is married and has four children. To make a living, Darlita owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. The main source of income for the business comes from buying and selling canned goods, snack foods, shampoo, soap & firewood in the local community. Darlita has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 6000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Darlita joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Darlita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. Darlita is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional canned goods, snack foods & firewood. This will be the 5th loan taken out by Darlita from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional canned goods, snack foods & stock of firewood.

location.town: Taguanao, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Aida's Group

texts.en:
Aida is the leader of this group. She resides in Balykchi, a small town in the Isykul region. She is 33 and married to a musician. Together with her husband, she brings up two daughters and a son. All three children are preschool age (under seven). 

In order to meet the family needs, Aida’s husband provides musical services at various celebrations and events. Aida helps her husband with that activity. In this way the family earns 15 000 soms per month. Aida applied for the loan because they need additional financial funds to purchase musical equipment in order to improve the quality of the provided musical services. In the future she wants to provide her children with a good education.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 

MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). 

MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase musical equipment.

loans.name: Natacha Estelle

texts.fr:
Commercante de 35 ans celibataire avec 2 enfants a sa charge dont l'age varie entre 2 et 14 ans.Ayant arrete ses etudes en classe de troisieme, pour subvenir aux besoins de sa famille elle se lance dans le commerce des legumes.Ses ventes sont de 10.000 a 50.000 frs par jour.
Avec le pret qu'elle va recevoir elle veut rnforcer son activite en achetant des legumes comme des gros paniers de choux, courgettes, carottes, filets d'oignos et d'ails, l'aubergine violette et differents legumes que l'on trouve sur le marche.

Cliente dynamique , elle s'arrange toujours a faire le bon chois des legumes fraiches pour sastifaire les besoins de ses clients.

Pour aller de l'avant , elle pense a  epargner pour payer les etudes de ses enfants, et ouvrir un autre etalage de vente des legumes  et elargir son activite
texts.en:
She is a 35 years old single merchant, with two dependent children aged two and fourteen. She left school in in ninth grade. To provide for her family, she started retailing vegetables. Her sales amount to 10,000 to 50,000 CFA daily.

With the loan she will receive, she wants to strengthen her business by purchasing vegetables such as large baskets of cabbage, zucchini, carrots, nets of onions and garlic, purple eggplants and various vegetables available on the market.

She is a dynamic customer and always manages to choose the right fresh vegetables to meet her customers' needs.

Moving forward, she is planning on saving for her children's education, and on opening another vegetable stall to broaden her business.

loans.use: to buy bags of potatoes, eggplants net bags, cabbage, zucchini, onions and garlic in nets, scallions

loans.name: Abdusamad

texts.ru: Абдусамад житель города Куляб. Ему 25 лет. Он женат. Имеет одного ребенка. Его жена, домохозяйка. Сам Абдусамад занимается торговлей на рынке "Сомон" города. Он имеет магазин со смешанным ассортиментом. Кроме того он занимается торговлей арбузов. Этим видом деятельности Абдусамад занимается уже четыре года. Она берет кредит для покупки порфюмерии и косметики, чтобы увеличить ассортимент своего товара.
texts.en: Abdusamad lives in the city of Kulob.  He is 25 years old, married and has one child.  His wife is a homemaker.  Abdusamad is involved in sales at the "Somon" city market.  He owns a store, where he sells various merchandise.  Besides this, he also sells watermelons.  Abdusamad has been involved in this type of business for four years.  He is requesting this loan for the purchase of perfumes and cosmetics in order to increase his merchandise selection.

loans.use: to purchase new perfumes and cosmetics

loans.name: Renaldy Antonio

texts.es:
El  señor Renaldy Antonio  vive en la ciudad de Managua, es casado, se dedica arduamente a laborar como analista de acreditaciones dedicándose a esta labor desde hace veinte años.
Es padre  de familia trabaja en la ciudad de Managua el señor Renaldy  visito nuestras instalación para solicitar un crédito  ya que necesitaba el crédito para invertir en una mejoras para su vivienda.
El  crédito los va a utilizar para la compra de materiales de construcción como: perlines y zinc 
y  agradece a ceprodel por el crédito 
Por que gracias a eso va a poder mejorar su vivienda.
texts.en:
Mr. Renaldy Antonio lives in the city of Managua.  He is married and works hard as an accreditation analyst, which he has been doing for the last 20 years. 

He visited our offices to request a loan for home improvement.  He plans to use the loan to buy profiles and zinc.  He is grateful to Ceprodel for the loan since he will be able to make his home more comfortable.

loans.use: To buy construction materials.

loans.name: Marcelina

texts.es: Marcelina es socia del Banco Comunal Señor de Huanca, tiene 33 años y vive con su pareja y dos hijos de 11 años y de un mes. Ella utilizará su préstamo para comprar mas ingredientes para su negocio de comida. Ella cocina comida típica criolla, que se varía entre sopas y arroz con patas, y la vende en una feria.  Hace un año ella se hizo socia de FINCA Perú y empezó su negocio de comida. Lo que mas le gusta a Marcelina de la organización son los ahorros, la puntualidad y la responsabilidad. Dice que tambien ha aprendido como tratar a la familia y la importancia de ser sincera y honesta. Aparte de su negocio de comidas Marcelina también ayuda a su novio con su negocio de mecánica de motos. Su meta para prosperar mas es comprar motos para arreglar y vender. Marcelina dice que de vez en cuando los problemas personales pueden afectar el trabajo pero que siempre sigue adelante.
texts.en:
Marcelina is a member of the “Senor de Huanca” Communal Bank. She is 33 years old and lives with her partner and 2 children, aged 11 years and 1 month respectively. 

She will use her loan to buy more ingredients for her meal-selling business. Marcelina cooks typical creole dishes, varying between soups and rice with potatoes, and she sells her meals at a fair.

Around a year ago Marcelina became a member of FINCA Peru and began her meals business. What she likes most about the organization is the savings accounts, the punctuality, and the responsibility. She says that she has learned how to deal with her family and the importance of being sincere and honest.

Apart from her meals business, Marcelina also helps her fiancé with his motorcycle mechanic business. Her goal for gaining more prosperity is to buy motorcycles to fix up and sell.

Marcelina comments that once in a while personal problems can affect her work but that she keeps on forging ahead.

loans.use: to buy more ingredients for her meal-selling business.

loans.name: Steven Muiruri

texts.en: Steven is a married man and they have one child aged four years old whom they wish to give a quality education to the university level. He runs a clothing sales business at Mutindwa in Nairobi. He has been in this business for two years now and he says his major challenge is financial constraints. He is using his loan of KES 20,000 to buy clothes and shoes to grow his business and meet the demands of his customers. He hopes to grow his business and in the future, put up his own business premise where he will not be paying rent. He describes himself as aggressive, clever and humble.

loans.use: to purchase clothes and shoes

loans.name: Hong

texts.en:
Hong is 53 year old, single, and lives with her family in Ho Chi Minh City. She supports her family through the income she earns from making clothes. 

She intends to take a loan to buy fabric, materials, and buy an overlock sewing machine to make a greater range of clothing to meet her customers' needs better. 

She hopes her business runs smoothly, and will help her to improve her living conditions. She plans to set a small part aside as savings for family emergencies.

loans.use: To buy an overlock sewing machine, fabrics, and other sewing materials.

loans.name: Jeriuth

texts.en: Jeriuth is a 36-year-old hardworking business woman. She is single and is blessed with 2 children. For the last 3 years she has been operating a retail shop to meet the needs of her family. Previously she was employed as a secretary.  In the next 5 years she wants to open up a supermarket. She is requesting for a loan of 20,000 Kenyan shilling to buy flour, rice and (mobile phone) airtime to sell.  Thanks to Faulu Kenya, she is now able to access credit facility.

loans.use: To buy  flour, rice and airtime

loans.name: Ben

texts.en: Ben is 35 years old and married with 3 children living in Hioma, Uganda. He owns a house, 3 cows and 10 goats and his family dream is to set up a ranch in the next six years. For 8 years he has been in produce business and he faces a challenge of the volatile produce prices which sometimes results in losses. In spite of this, he longs to set up a food store and also to export his produce. Ben needs the loan facility to buy maize and beans for sale.

loans.use: to buy maize & beans for sale

loans.name: Ekiru

texts.en: Ekiru is 24 years old, married, has one child and earns a living by running a kiosk where he buys and sells fish. He has been in business for five years and earns KES 16,900. He is applying for his second loan from KADET LTD after paying his first one fully and on time. He will use the new loan to buy more fish to sell to his customers. With the profits he expects to earn, he will buy fishing nets. His dream is to improve his family's living standards.

loans.use: to expand his business of buying and selling fish.

loans.name: Recajoy

texts.en:
Recajoy is 22 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is single. 
Recajoy has a shop where she makes and sells home-made munchkins and peanut butter. She has run this business for two years. She has requested a loan for 5,000 PHP to buy raw ingredients to make snacks to sell.
Recajoy has been a member of Kiva partner, HSPFI, since 2010. In the future, Recajoy hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients to make snacks to sell.

loans.name: Juan Andres

texts.es:
Juan es un joven,de 23 años, soltero y vive junto con sus padres, gracias al apoyo economico y moral de sus padres se ha recibido en la carrera de derecho, siendo su mama quien lo impulso para encontrar trabajo mas rapido, ya que ella labora en la profesion, y por medio de amistad se le hizo posible.

Juan, al ver la necesidad en su casa,desea mejorar el techo, ya que por ser el zinc, muy viejo, se le pasan gotas de agua, en temporada de invierno, situacion que desea cambiar, para el bienestar comun de la familia. Ya que ahora puede apoyar a sus padres con este cambio y que se le ha hecho mas rapido mediante el financiamiento en Afodenic, siendo recomendado por un amigo, para que este mejor situacion. Su casa es de concreto, y gracias a Dios, se han cubrido las necesidades, pero hoy se siente motivado hacer algo propio y de beneficios para muchos.
texts.en:
Juan is a young man, 23 years old, single and lives with his parents. Thanks to financial and moral support from his parents, he has been able to complete law school. His mother is the one who encouraged him to find work quickly, since she is also a lawyer, and through a friend he was able to do so.

Juan, recognizing the need to improve his house, wants to put in a better roof, since water leaks through the zinc beams in the winter. He wants to change the situation for the well being of his family. Now that he is able to support his parents, he wants to make the improvements quickly with the help of a loan from AFODENIC [Kiva Field Partner], which was recommended to him by a friend. 

His house is made of concrete and, thanks to god, he has been able to supply his family with necessities so far, but he now feels motivated to do to something more and benefit many other people.

loans.use: to replace the entire roof of his house.

loans.name: Javier

texts.en:
Javier came to the US from Argentina in search for a better future for his family. When he arrived in 2001, he had no experience in landscaping. Once he got more experience in the field, he decided to open his landscaping business. Javier said the biggest challenge was dedicating all of his time and money to organizing the business while providing his children with financial support. As he said, adjusting to this “new country, new place, new work” was an amazing process and a learning experience. Javier now owns a successful landscaping business in South Florida and has three employees.

With this loan from Accion USA, Javier will buy a new lawn mower and other equipment that needs to be replaced. In the future, he hopes to keep expanding his business with new clients and get more contracts with commercial buildings and condos as well as private homes.

loans.use: To pay for a lawn mower and other equipment.

loans.name: Charita

texts.en:
Charita is 45 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has seven children. 

Charita has a retail shop that sells canned goods, snacks, and beverages. She has had this business for five years. She has requested a loan of PHP 4,000 to buy more canned goods, snacks, and beverages.

Charita is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Charita hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages.

loans.name: Boubacar

texts.fr:
Monsieur Boubacar est âgé de plus de 35 ans,  marié et père de deux enfants. Il habite le quartier Kaboïla I-Kélétiguila, le centre ville de Sikasso.
Monsieur Boubacar après avoir mené plusieurs activités sans succès,  s’est initié  depuis plus de trois ans à cette activité de commerce d’articles divers. Il dispose d’une boutique à Wayerema où il mène cette activité d’achat et de vente d’articles tels  les Jeans, Ferardines, Abacos, Chaussures, souliers,  ceintures etc. Il est beaucoup sollicité de sa clientèle pour la qualité de ses produits. 
Pour satisfaire sa clientèle de plus en plus croissante, il décida de rejoindre l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso il y a environ un  an. Il a bénéficié de 2 crédits qui ont été tous correctement remboursés. 
 Il sollicite ainsi ce troisième crédit pour pouvoir acheter 10 paires de chaussures “Ferardine”, 5 complets de veste “Abacos”, 5 paires de souliers, une douzaine de ceintures, 15 pantalons de qualité différentes et 10 chemises différentes. Il s’approvisionne à Bamako avant de les revendre de façon ambulante, au comptant et à crédit, dans les différentes structures professionnelles de Sikasso ville et souvent jusqu’à Baguinéda sur la route de Ségou.
Il envisage réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel de 200 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé essentiellement pour contribuer aux dépenses familiales, payer les intérêts de son prêt et investir le reste dans son activité.
texts.en:
Boubacar is more than 35 years old, married, and the father of two children. He lives in the Kaboïla I-Kélétiguila neighborhood in downtown Sikasso. After running several unsuccessful businesses, he launched himself into retail more than three years ago. 

He has a shop in Wayerema, where he buys and sells various items such as jeans, belts, shoes (Ferardine, …), and Abacos vests. He's very much sought after by his clientele thanks to the quality of his products.

To meet an ever-increasing customer demand, he decided to join Kiva's partner, Soro Yiriwaso, approximately one year ago. He has already obtained two loans, which were both repaid without problems.

He's seeking his third loan in order to buy 10 pairs of "Ferardine" shoes, 5 "Abacos" vests, 5 pairs of shoes, a dozen belts, 15 pairs of trousers of various quality, and 10 different shirts.

He gets his supplies in Bamako, and resell as a traveling salesman, for cash and on credit, in the various professional institutions in Sikasso, and often as far as Baguinéda, on the road to Ségou.

With this loan, he foresees turning a monthly profit of XOF 200'000 (ca US$ 400), to be used mainly to help paying the family expenses and repay the loan. He will reinvest the remainder in his business.

loans.use: to buy 15 pairs shoes, 5 vests, a dozen belts, 15 pairs of trousers, and 10 shirts.

loans.name: Katana

texts.en:
Katana is a married man with four school going children. His wife Rehema is a farmer who contributes to the provision of the family's basic needs. He owns a house with neither electricity nor piped water. His greatest monthly expense is food for his family.  

Katana has operated a tailoring business for the past 9 years; his potential clients are the local area residents. He faces a major challenge of debtors taking too long to pay their debts. He dreams of expanding his business.

With the Kshs 20,000 he wants to purchase fabrics and embroideries for his business. He decided to join Yehu to access fund to expand his business.

loans.use: To purchase fabrics and embroideries for his business.

loans.name: Urantogos

texts.en:
Urantogos, 33, is a teacher.  She has been teaching for seven years, after she graduating from college. 

She lives with her husband and daughters in Kherlen, a boundary town of western Mongolia.  Her husband works as a fireman, but his income is not so good. As well as Urantogos’s monthly salary, they don't have enough money to meet family expenses.  

Urantogos and her husband decided to start a new taxi service business to increase their family income.  Now she needs over MNT 3.500.000 to cover the cost of purchasing a new car to start their taxi business.

loans.use: to cover the cost of purchasing a new car for start taxi business.

loans.name: Resiato

texts.en:
Resiato is 38 years old. She is married to Maisokante and the couple is blessed with four children. For the past two years, Resiato has run a general store and she earns a monthly income of 5,000 KES.

Resiato is requesting her first loan with KADET LTD to buy stocks of sugar, rice, and maize flour. In the future, she hopes to educate her children and open a supermarket.

loans.use: to buy sugar, rice, and maize flour

loans.name: Edis Alberto

texts.es:
Edis, quiere invertir en una nueva compra para mejorar su condición, comprará un motor para bombeo, y como no cuenta con la cantidad necesaria de dinero solicita este nuevo préstamo para que le ayude a cubrir el gasto y contar con esta nueva herramienta que le permitirá hacer más fácil su trabajo.
El ha tenido mejores cosechas por la compra de los insumos agrícolas que fueron obtenidos a través del préstamo anterior, mejorando sus siembras y la producción para alimentar a su familia.
texts.en:
Edis wishes to invest in a new purchase to improve his living conditions.  He will buy a new pump.  As he does not have the money he needs, he is requesting this new loan to help him cover the expense and have a new tool that will make his job easier.
He purchased farm inputs with the previous loan, and this has enabled him to produce a better harvest, and improve sowing and production to feed his family.

loans.use: to supplement the purchase of a pump.

loans.name: Blanca Judith

texts.es: Blanca Judith de 32 años de edad,labora como docente de primaria desde hace 6 años. Solicita su crédito para hecharle la ceramica a su   casa, y de esta manera brindarle mejores condiciones a su familia, es importante mencionar que en sus horas libres se dedica a vender productos botanicos en los que obtiene ingresos para el sosten familiar.  Su sueño es seguir mejorando la infraestructura de su vivienda y que su familia goze de salu y trabajo.
texts.en: Blanca Judith, 32, has been working as a primary school teacher for the past 6 years.  She is requesting a loan in order to install tile on her house and in this way provide her family with better living conditions. It is important to mention that in her free time she sells botanical products in order to earn more family income. Her dream is to continue improving her home’s infrastructure and that her family enjoys good health and jobs.

loans.use: to install tile.

loans.name: Ma. Villamor

texts.en:
Ma. Villamor  is 41 years old and lives in the Philippines.  She is widowed with 2 children. 

Ma. Villamor has an animal or veterinary shop that sells animal feed and medications.  She has had this business for 2 years.  She requested a loan for 15,000 PHP to buy stocks of animal feed and medications to sell.

Ma. Villamor  has been a member of HSPFI since 2009.  In the future, Ma. Villamor  hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: To buy stocks of animal feeds and medication to sell.

loans.name: Abeteraine Bughoye Group

texts.en:
Ferediano is a 48-year-old married woman with eight children living in Kasese, Uganda. She has been selling cassava flour for eight years. She started by selling one bag per month and now she sells nine bags of cassava flour in a month. 

Her hardships are seasonal weather and inadequate capital to purchase enough stock. Her personal goals are educating her children and building a permanent house for residence, while her business goals are expanding the business into new markets and moving it to a more permanent location. Ferediano wants money to buy cassava flour to sell. She is a member of the above-mentioned group, in which each member guarantees the others in accessing a loan.

loans.use: to buy cassava flour to sell.

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en: Joyce lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with five children, and four of her children go to school. She has one additional family member. She sells charcoal from home. She sells her products on a retail basis. She also gets additional income from selling vegetables and fruits from home. She has been in this business for the last 10 years. She works six days a week. She has requested a loan of 500,000 Ugandan shillings from MCDT SACCO to buy more bags of charcoal. Her major business challenges are transportation and seasonality. Her goals and aspirations are to become a wholesaler and also to buy a delivery van to ease with transportation. She lives in her own house, and her family has access to electricity but doesn’t have access to piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and food.

loans.use: to buy more bags of charcoal

loans.name: Jesus Flimi Group

texts.fr: JESUS FLIMI est un groupe composé de trois personnes qui résident dans le même quartier. Afin d'élever le niveau de leur activité, ce groupe sollicite l'appui financier de ALIDé. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Adébayo (celle qui a la main levée sur la photo) est âgée de 29 ans. Adébayo n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Adébayo est mariée à un pêcheur du nom de Michel. Le couple a cinq enfants, dont certains scolarisés et tous à leur charge. Adébayo vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Les diverses charges du ménage sont supportées par le couple. Pour cette raison, Adébayo vend du poisson frais à son domicile depuis quinze et de l’huile d’arachide et de la farine de manioc de façon secondaire. Adébayo s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaire et son revenu, Adébayo sollicite ensemble avec les membres du groupe JESUS FLIMI, un sixième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les crédits reçus antérieurement ont été bien remboursés.

loans.use: Acheter des poissons frais, des bidons d'huile et de la farine de manioc.

loans.name: Cfjdt 41 Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de CFJDT 41 est un sous groupe de la Convergence du Village de Tassette. Il est composé de 8 femmes  habitant dans  un village situé à environ 22 km de la ville principale. La présidente, Madame Dieynaba, mariée et mère de famille fait du commerce de légumes depuis maintenant 10 ans. Elle sollicite un crédit pour acheter  des légumes entre autres, choux, aubergine, carotte, navet… pour ensuite les revendre dans le marché local.Elle commence sa journée à 8h pour la terminer à 16h. 
Avec les bénéfices, elle pourra mettre un peu d’argent de coté et améliorer les conditions alimentaires de la famille.
Son seul souhait serait de hisser son activité à un niveau plus haut avec l’appui de l’IMCEC pour le financer
texts.en:
The group called CFJDT 41 is a sub-group of the Gathering of the Village of Tassette. It is made up of eight women living in a village situated around 22 kilometers from the town. The president, Madame Dieynaba, married and the mother of a family, has been selling vegetables for 10 years now. She is requesting a loan to buy vegetables, among others, cabbage, eggplant, carrots, and turnips to resell at the local market. She begins her day at 8 am and ends it at 4 pm. 

With the profits, she will be able to put a little money aside and improve the nutrition of the family. Her only wish would be to raise the level of her business higher with the support of IMCEC to finance her.

loans.use: to buy fruit and vegetables destined for resale

loans.name: María Del Carmen

texts.en:
Maria del Carmen lost her husband when her last and little baby had 1 year old, so with all her pain for her husband dead she had to work very hard to support her family and maintain her 5 sons. She knew that the life is not easy, she was a clear example of fight and constancy, so she started to sold used clothes and some bazaar articles, with the pass of the time she was increase her merchandise. Today she has 63 years old and has her business in a popular market and other store established in a fix place, she started her business 40 years ago, started low but with her effort Maria’s business grew slowly but sure and always go ahead with it.

Maria is requesting for a loan of USD$ 825 to purchase toys and Christmas merchandise that she is very sure that this season will sales all her merchandise, she offers to repay the loan in a term of 6 to 12 months.

** \"This text has been translated from the following original business description.\"

María del Carmen quedó viuda cuando su hijo el más pequeño apenas tenía 1 año de nacido, aún con la pena del fallecimiento de su esposo, ella tenía el deber de enfrentarse a la vida, ya que había que mantener a cinco niños. Como era conciente de que la vida no es fácil, ella se convirtió en claro ejemplo de lucha y superación, así comenzó vendiendo ropa usada y algunos artículos de bazar, al paso del tiempo fue incrementando su mercancía. Hoy ella tiene 63 años de edad y vende en un mercado ambulante y además tiene un puesto establecido, y lleva con este negocio 40 años, empezando muy lento pero con esfuerzo y superación lo esta sacando adelante.

Maria esta solicitando un préstamo por USD $ 825 para comprar juguetes y regalos navideños que ella esta segura se venderán muy bien en esta navidad, ofreciendo el pago del mismo en un periodo de 6 a 12 meses.

loans.use: Purchase toys and Christmas merchandise

loans.name: Vera

texts.en:
Vera is married with two children. After graduating from medical school, she worked as a nurse in a laboratory. In 2003 Vera decided to become self-employed. She rented a vending facility and started her own business selling phyto chemical products that are beneficial to human health. Vera received her first loan from “Nadiya Ukraine” in June of 2004. She used the money to increase the assortment of phyto concentrates she offered in her store. Good quality, nutritious products rich in amino acids, vitamins and minerals have found wide acceptance with healthy eaters. Moreover, Vera has enjoyed being able to help many of her customers with their health problems. Vera is requesting $500 to increase her supply of phyto products. The loan will help her purchase a variety of phyto chemicals, natural extracts, and essential oils that are used as pharmaceuticals and also in the cosmetic and food industries. A range of phyto products including an anti-cancer precursor, anti-oxidants, anti-inflammatory and hypertensive products, sweeteners, and food supplements will help Vera continue to meet her customer’s needs for total health and wellness.

Віра – одружена, в неї двоє дітей. В неї медична освіта, вона певний час працювала лаборантом. В 2003 році Віра вирішила почати власний бізнес. Вона орендувала торгівельне приміщення та почала торгувати фітопрепаратами, які є дуже корисними для здоров’я людини. Віра отримала першу позику від «Надії України» ще в червні 2004 року. Вона використала отримані гроші для того, щоб розширити асортимент фітоконцентратів у власній крамничці. Якісні продукти, багаті на амінокислоти, вітаміни та мінерали користуються високим попитом серед людей, які намагаються дотримуватися здорового образу життя. Більш за все Вірі подобається допомагати багатьом покупцям з вирішенням їхніх проблем зі здоров’ям. Віра просить про позику в 500 доларів для того, щоб збільшити асортимент фітопрепаратів. Позика допоможе їй закупити різноманітні фітопродукти, натуральні екстракти, природні масла, які використовуються в фармацевтичній, косметичній та харчовій промисловості. Широкий вибір фітоконцентратів, а саме, засобів, що попереджують появлення ракових пухлин та знижують тиск, антиоксидантів, протизапальних препаратів, цукрозамінників та харчових добавок надасть Вірі можливість й надалі допомагати її клієнтам із вирішенням певних проблем зі здоров’ям та самопочуттям.

loans.use: To increase the supply of phyto products

loans.name: Lucia

texts.en: Lucia is married and has two children. She lives in the Lumo area of Dar es Salaam. Lucia sells fresh fish near her residence. She collects fresh fish from the shores of the Indian Ocean and stores them in plastic vessels using ice blocks in her business premise. She wants to make her business efficient by buying a deep freezer, which could store more fish. This will enable her to make more sales and thus more profit. Next year, her first born will join secondary school. The increased income will enable her to save for school fees. To implement her plan, she needs USD 1000.

loans.use: To purchase a deep freezer

loans.name: Tina Abla

texts.fr:
Born on April 10, 1959 in Ahépé in the Yoto prefecture, Tina Abla T. is married and the mother of four (4) children. She makes a living selling tomatoes and other condiments, but can't expand her business because of a lack of funds.

She has the mind of an entrepreneur and manages her business well. She is asking for a loan of $800 to enlarge her business and increase her income.

Translated from French by Alexandra Jaffe, Kiva volunteer.

Née le 10 avril 1959 à Ahépé dans la préfecture de Yoto, Madame T. Tina Abla est mariée et mère de quatre (4) enfants. Commerçante de tomate et autres condiments, elle n’avance toujours pas dans son activité par manque de fonds de commerce.

Elle a un esprit d’entreprenariat et douée d’une bonne gestion de ses activités. Elle sollicite un crédit de $800 pour augmenter la taille de son activité en vue d’en tirer plus de revenus.

loans.use: Purchase of tomatoes and other condiments

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
I have construction being done that I have not been able to finish due to lack of money, but now I would like to finish it once and for all as the current space is too small and uncomfortable for my family of six. Also, I would like to put in a bathroom. I am asking for $500.00 to finish the construction and put in a bathroom.

Translated from Spanish by Rebecca Pendleton, Kiva Volunteer.

Tengo una construcción que no he podido terminar por falta de dinero pero ahora me gustaría terminarla ya que el espacio es muy reducido para mi familia y también muy incomodo debido a que somos 6 de familia además me gustaria poner un baño” Solicito $ 500.00 dlls para terminar mi construcción y poner el baño.

loans.use: Construction of bathroom and two rooms

loans.name: Karla

texts.es:
I have sold firewood for 5 years, since I lost my other job. I have various clients who live near my neighborhood. I have to do this work because the money my husband earns isn't enough to cover our home's expenses, since we have 3 kids in school, and we want to keep giving them an education. They help us deliver the orders that we have. We are poor and honest people, and we teach our children the value of money and that it's necessary to work and be responsible.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer

Yo me didico a la venta de leña hace 5 años, desde que me qwuede sin trabajo. Tengo variso clientes que viven serca de mi becindario. Tengo que hacer este trabajo porque con lo que gana mi esposo no nos ajusta con nuestros gastos que tenemos en nuestro hogar, ya que tenemos 3 hijos que estudian y nosotros no queremos que ellos dejen de estudiar, ellos nos ayudan a repartir los pedidos que tenemos. Somos personas pobres y honradas y les enserñamos a nuestros hojos el valor del dinero que hay que trabajar y ser responzables.

loans.use: Purchase of firewood

loans.name: Sles Tol's Group

texts.en:
These three families live in a small village near the Mekong River about twenty kilometers north of Phnom Penh. Like many men in this area, the husbands have all been fishing since they were boys. Two of them, Mr. S. Math and Mr. S. Ousman, were fishing at the time of the loan interview. They do not appear in this photograph. They are requesting this, their first group loan from Maxima, to buy fishing nets, a second-hand motor for one boat and for general boat repair costs.

1- Mr. S. Tol (aged 45) and his wife (center couple in image) married in 1989. They have six children, three of whom study in the village school. One son fishes with his father. His wife takes care of the children and household as well as sells the fish her husband catches. They are saving to buy a car that they will then use as a taxi. They are requesting a loan from MAXIMA for US$300 and will use this money to buy fishing nets and a second-hand motor for his fishing boat.

2- Mr. S. Math (aged 39) and his wife (far right of image) married in 1990. They have four children, two of whom study in the village school. His wife sells green papaya salad at the afternoon market along the lane that runs through their village. They are requesting a loan from MAXIMA for the first time for $US100 and will use this money to buy fishing nets.

3- Mr. S. Ousman (aged 44) and his wife (far left of image) married in 1986. They have six children, two of whom study in school, two of whom have stopped studying and two of whom are physically disabled. His wife describes the disability as “their arms and legs don’t work”. She said that the children must be fed, clothed, bathed and be given assistance with any other activity requiring mobility. S. and his wife also farm - both to provide food for the house and to supplement their income. They are requesting a loan from MAXIMA for the first time of $US200 and will use this money to buy fishing nets and to cover general boat repair costs.

loans.use: Group loan to purchase fishing nets, a boat motor and to repair fishing boats.

loans.name: Emerenciana

texts.en:
Emerenciana is 44 years old and has three children who are 22, 20, and 5 years old.  For the last 12 years, she has been part of the Communal Bank “Bienestar II”, or “Well Being II”.  Currently, she is the president of her bank. Emerenciana owns a transportation business with her husband, and, presently, the couple has two vehicles.  
Emerenciana desires a loan of 3000 soles. She will use the majority of her loan to open a small store in her house, and the rest to buy tires for her two vehicles.
With her savings she has been able to buy a piece of land and to build a house. In the future, she hopes to be able to add a second floor to her house and to expand her transportation business. 
Emerenciana is very happy to be part of the Communal Bank whose members can confiD. in each other. She has learned to save and to enjoy the lessons that teach her to be a better person.

loans.use: Opening of a small store, and purchase of tires for two vehicles

loans.name: Lugoba A 2021(Iii) Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Ruth N.. She is currently in the business of operating a retail shop and is requesting a loan of UGX 700,000 to increase her stock. Ruth is 35 years old and is married with 2 children aged 2 and 5, both of whom go to school. Each week, Ruth makes approximately UGX 40,000 in profit and combined with the extra profit from her loan, she hopes to be able to save and buy a commercial motorcycle.

Ruth is joined in her small group by Gorette N., Amina N., Betty M., and Christine N.. Gorette N. is currently in the business of selling stationary and is requesting a loan of UGX 900,000 to add in stock in the shop.

Amina N. is currently in the business of charcoal sales and is requesting a loan of UGX 500,000 to expand her business.

Betty M. is currently in the business of selling snacks and is requesting a loan of UGX 200,000 to invest in the business.

Christine N. is currently in the business of running a restaurant and is requesting a loan of UGX 500,000 to buy more foodstuffs.

loans.use: To add stock to her retail shop

loans.name: Jane

texts.en: Jane is 25 years old and is married with two children, ages 6 years and 7 months. Jane  is a food vendor  and she also sells clothes. Every day, Janevworks from 8am to 10pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $250 from her sales.  She now hopes for a loan to buy more items for her business.

loans.use: To buy more inventory.

loans.name: Domitila

texts.es:
Mrs. Domitila A. R. is 50 years old; she studied up until second grade primary school. She is married with no children. She lives in the rural area of San Luis in the district of Salpo, in the province of Otuzco in the Department of La Libertdad, Peru.

Her business started with the raising of small animals, and in parallel to this she made a living from farming. Later she learned how to refurbish and make shoes by way of her brothers, who made their entire living from this work. At the beginning when she started to make footwear she had a tough time, but over time and with practice she was making better quality shoes.

She belongs to the Communal Bank “Mujeres Trabajadoras” (Working Women) with whom she received her first loan of 2300.00 PEN which she paid back in 4 months; this loan served to invest in her businesses; it was distributed in one part to purchase the necessary materials to make the shoes (leather, glue, needles, synthetic material, etc.) and the other part to buy seed in order to plant potatoes and cereal crops (barley, wheat, and corn), which because it was quite profitable has gone very well.

With this loan of $850.00 (2300.00 PEN) which she will pay in four months, she will again buy the necessary materials to make footwear. Her biggest dream is to buy a stand in the city of Trujillo where she will sell footwear.

Translated from Spanish by Diane Lister, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Domitila A. R. tiene 50 años de edad, estudio hasta el segundo grado de primaria. Es casada pero no tiene hijos aún Vive en el caserío de San Luís en el distrito de Salpo en la provincia de Otuzco departamento La Libertad – Perú.

Su negocio se inicia con la crianza de animales menores, paralelo a eso se dedicaba a la chacra. Posteriormente aprendió a renovar y fabricar zapatos por medio de sus hermanos que toda una vida se dedicaron a eso. Cuando empezó a elaborar el calzado al principio tuvo dificultad, con el tiempo y la práctica fue elaborándolos de mejor calidad.

Es socia del Banco Comunal “Mujeres Trabajadoras” en el que recibió su primer préstamo de S/.2300.00 el cual fue pagado en un plazo de 4 meses, le sirvió para invertir en sus negocios; lo distribuyó una parte en comprar los materiales necesarios para poder fabricar los zapatos (cuero, pegamento, agujas, material sintético, etc.) y la otra parte para comprar las semillas para poder sembrar los cereales (cebada, trigo, maíz) y la siembra de papa, el cual todo le ha ido muy bien ya que tuvo bastantes utilidades.

Con el préstamo de S/. 2300.00 el que cancelara en cuatro meses comprará también el material necesario para la fabricación del calzado.

Su mayor sueño es comprar un stand en la ciudad de Trujillo en el que ofrezca el calzado.

loans.use: With the loan she will buy materials to make footwear

loans.name: Cleotilde Francisca

texts.es:
Cleotilde R. currently lives in the Villanueva municipality in the city of Chinandega. She owns a small grocery store, which she has been stocking with many different products over its 14 years of existence. Her husband and three children have all supported her by attending her clients and shopping for the products at the market or in supply stores.

The necessity Cleotilde is facing today is the need to purchase products to sell in her store immediately. For this reason, she has turned to Ceprodel to receive a loan that will allow her to buy the necessary merchandise to then resell in her store, and in that way continue with the maintenance of her humble home.

Translated from Spanish by Evelyn Garcia, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Cleotilde R. actualmente vive en el municipio de Villanueva en la ciudad de Chinandega. Su negocio es el de pulpería el cual ha venido surtiendo de diferentes productos a medida que los años han venido transcurriendo ya que este negocio posee 14 años de existir. Su esposo y sus tres hijos han apoyado de igual manera a la señora Cleotilde atendiendo a sus clientes y realizando las compras de los productos en el mercado o tiendas proveedoras.

La necesidad que hoy en día atraviesa la señora Cleotilde es la pronta necesidad de adquirir sus productos para comercializarlos. Es por esto que ella acude a CEPRODEL para ser beneficiada con un crédito que le permita la compra de su mercadería para luego venderla a sus clientes y de esta manera continuar con el mantenimiento de su humilde hogar.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise to sell in her small grocery store.

loans.name: Majidan's Group

texts.en:
Majidan baji is married to I. A., who is 59 years old. (Baji is a term meaning "elder sister" in Urdu.) Shamim and her family live in a small city called Arifwala in Pakistan. Shamim owns a two room brick house, and she is a mother of three children: two sons and one daughter. Majida’s daughter is in 10th standard, and her sons work as property dealers. Her husband is a wedding organizer, and has been in this profession for the last 7 years. She is applying for a loan for her husband’s business, so that he will be able to buy attractive materials which look nice for occasions like weddings.

She has been joined in her group by a few more members who are: Zahida baji, who wants loan for her decorative embroidery business; Khalida baji, who wants a loan for her grocery shop business; Abida baji, who wants a loan for her vegetable business; and I. baji, who wants a loan for her cardboard business.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To expand their businesses

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria I. is 42 years old and is married with 6 children. She lives in Benin City, Nigeria. Victoria goes to the nearby villages in Benin City to buy yams and then sells the yams to retailers in the city. She learned this business in 4 years and she started her own business in 2003. She has been a LAPO client for the past 4 years.

Victoria needs a loan of $875 USD to buy more yams to sell.

loans.use: To buy more yams to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To invest in the purchase of more pants and shoes for her small business.

loans.name: Savin

texts.en:
Mrs. Savin P., 31, and her husband, Mr. Yoin Meas, 34, who live on an Island of Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh, were married in 1997 and have three children: one daughter and two sons. One of her sons is in school.

Mrs. Savin has been a silk weaver for nine years, a skill she learned from her sister-in-law. She sells her finished products to the middle man in the village, who takes them to sell in Phnom Penh, while her husband drives a horse cart to haul dirt for leveling house foundations. Now, Savin is requesting a loan of $250 to purchase cows for raising.

loans.use: To purchase cows for raising.

loans.name: Hannah

texts.en: Hannah is 37 years old and married with six children. She is the leader of a lending group under LAPO MICROFINANCE. Hannah produces and sells yogurt ice cream. She has a bicycle boy who assists her in the sale of ice cream. Also, some of her customers buy in bulk to sell to school children. Hannah needs the loan amount of $850 to purchase one deep freezer in order to meet the increasing demands of her customers. She says when she meets the demands of customers, she will not lose them to competitors. Hannah says thank you to all that made this loan possible.

loans.use: To Purchase one deep freezer

loans.name: Mrs. Meas Seng's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Meas S. is a group leader of four, who all live in Sam Raong Village in Takeo Province. She is a 58-year-old widow with five children, one of whom is a farmer, while another two are attending the local school. The remaining two are too young to work or study because they are at the ages of one and five years old.

Mrs. Meas S. has a small piece of land where she cultivates rice to earn a living. In this business, she now faces a small problem because her field is infertile, which is having a bad effect on her crop. To solve this problem, Mrs. Meas S. decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizers to support her field to make her crop more productive.

This is a group loan consisting of mainly end-of-term loans. Two members have end-of-term loans and the other two have monthly payment loans. They are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main product because they are the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. These allow them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers to support her field to make her crop more productive.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en: Grace O. sells food stuff like rice at a place called Air Force near Shama. She also owns a grocery store. Grace has received no formal education. She is married and has five dependents. Her husband is a military officer. Grace has been selling groceries and food stuff since 1996. She is responsible for assisting her husband in providing the basic needs of the family. Her loan will be used as an additional capital to increase the sale of rice and other groceries. And also to ease her transportation costs. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to reinvest into the business.

loans.use: Grace would like to increase the sale of rice and other groceries.

loans.name: Yaa

texts.en: Yaa B. is 60 years old. She is married and the mother of four kids. Currently all four of the children are in school. As old as she is, Yaa loves to sell. She has been selling fresh and smoked (dried) fish for five years to support her family. She treks to the city of Kumasi in the Ashanti region to buy her stock of fish from the wholesalers and fishmongers. She wants to use the loan to buy cartons of fish to meet the daily demands of her customers. She hopes to use part of her profit to support her kids in school and also save part to celebrate the Christmas with them. Yaa is a member of a community group called All Nations Trust Group. In this group, members guarantee and support one another to repay their loans. Yaa would be grateful for your assistance.

loans.use: To buy cartons of fresh and dried fish

loans.name: Le Thi

texts.vi:
Chị Lê Thị Yên  năm nay 40  tuổi, Chị tham gia Quỹ tình thương được 2 năm.Trong suốt thời gian tham gia Quỹ chị Yên luôn vay vốn để đầu tư vào buôn bán thịt lợn.Cùng với sự giúp đỡ của chồng và các con hiện tại công việc  buôn bán đang rất thuận lợi và là nguồn thu nhập chủ yếu của gia đình chị Yên hiện nay với thu nhập 2.500.000đ/ tháng. 
Vòng vốn tới chị mong muốn được vay 9.000.000đ để đầu tư cho công việc buôn bán của gia đình.
texts.en:
Mrs. Le Thi Y., aged 40, has been a member of TYM Fund for two years. For the past two years, she has been using all the loans from TYM to invest in her meat-selling business in the farmer market. With the help of her husband and children, the business has been going very well and is the family’s main source of income. Their monthly income is 2500000 VND. In the next round of loan, she would like to borrow 9000000 ($525) to invest in her business.

Translated from Vietnamese by Khoa NguY., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Business

loans.name: Las Divinas Group

texts.es: El grupo "Las Divinas" esta representado por la señora Mary Evelin e integrada por 15 miembros los cuales residen en el mismo barrio donD. todos los socios se conocen D. varios años, por lo que gozan D. confianza y unión. En general los socios (as) se dedican a actividades como la panadería, trasporte público, confección D. prendas D. vestir, empleadas del hogar, venta D. comida, bebida y a la construcción D. viviendas. La competencia en el rubro comercial y D. servicios es granD. pero los socios (as) saben como superarlo para seguir trabajando y poder tener mejores ingresos. El destino del financiamiento es para la compra D. productos, materiales, insumos y herramientas para incrementar sus ingresos y así  poder mejorar su calidad D. vida y la D. sus familias. Los socios (as) son gente trabajadora y honesta como lo  han demostrado en anteriores ciclos, por lo que cuentan con experiencia en el manejo D. fondos y en grupos solidarios.
texts.en:
The 'Las Divinas' group is represented by Mary Evelin and is maD. up of 15 members who live in the same neighbourhood, who have known each other for a number of years, and who enjoy trust and solidarity as a result. The members work in activities including baking and selling bread, public transport, clothing manufacturing, domestic services, the sale of food and drinks, and housing construction. There is strong competition in the field of goods and services, but the members know how to overcome this to continue working and increasing their income. The loan will be used to buy products, materials, basic supplies and tools to increase their income and improve the quality of life for themselves and their families. The members are hard-working and honest people, as they have demonstrated in previous loan cycles. They have experience in managing funds and in working in solidarity groups.

Translated from Spanish by Sally Bolton, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Diola

texts.es: Diola es casada y vive con su pareja y sus dos hijos adolescentes. Ella posee un gran carisma y muchas ganas de progresar, lo cual se ve reflejado en el trabajo que realiza desde hace 10 años, el cual consiste en vender artículos metálicos como las bases de sombríllas o paraguas, las que elabora junto a su socio, dentro de el taller que tiene instalado en el segundo piso de su casa; pero para elaborar estos diversos instrumentos tienen que comprar diversos materiales, es por ello que salen de madrugada a las tiendas de metales para  adquirir lo necesario y así cuando llegan a su taller se ocupan en diseñar  grandes cantidades, los cuales después serán vendidos en diversos lugares de la selva, donde Diola suele viajar. Para el futuro ella y su socio desean abrir un taller de metales en un local cercano a las zonas comerciales, pues hay más demanda y mayores opciones de hacer crecer su negocio. Ella viene trabajando con MFP más de 10 años y este es su quinto préstamo, lo que demuestra la fidelidad que ha tenido con la institución  y con el grupo de amistades con quienes está muy contenta de trabajar. Con los 1500 soles que solicita comprará grandes cantidades de materiales, pues cada fin de mes tendrá que viajar a la selva para  atender los pedidos que tiene.
texts.en:
Diola is married and lives with her partner and two teenage children. She has great charisma and strong desires to grow, which is reflected in the work she has been doing for 10 years, which is selling metal articles such as the bases of sunshades or umbrellas. She makes them with a colleague inside the shop she has installed on the second floor of her home. But in order to make these various items she has to buy a variety of materials. So she leaves early in the morning to the metal stores to acquire what is needed and in this whay when they arrive at her shop she busies herself in designing large quantities, which later will be sold in various places in the jungle where Diola usually travels. In the future she and her colleague wish to open a metal shop in a locale close to the commercial zones, as there is more demand and greater options to grow her business. Sh ehas been working with MFP for more than 10 years and this is her 5th loan, which demonstrates the commitment she has had with the institution and with the group of friends with whom she is very happy to work. With the 1500 soles that she is seeking she will buy large quantities of materials, as every end of the month she will have to travel to the jungle to take care of the orders that she has.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy a large quantity of materials for her business

loans.name: Valeria

texts.en:
Mambo (Greetings!) from Tanzania! This is twenty-three-year-old Valeria M. from Mwanza. Valeria has been making furniture since 2003. She sells chairs, tables, beds and doors. She works for twelve hours a day, six days a week, and is assisted by her husband. Valeria currently earns about $150 a month from her business. She is requesting a loan of $400 to buy lumber for making more furniture. In the future, she plans to increase her stock. Valeria thanks you for supporting her!

ABOUT SELFINA:
SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, so they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of micro-leasing is that is allows clients to use their business equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, which enables them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To buy lumber for making furniture.

loans.name: Lona

texts.en:
Lona I.  is currently in the business of selling fish and onions and is requesting a loan to open up a shop.  Lona is 39 years old and is widowed.   She has 3 children and her children go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to pay school fees for her children. 

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services, which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To open up a shop

loans.name: Salafune

texts.en: Salafune L., 48, is married with five  children. She has two years of experience in the plantation business. She sells to the public and villagers, five days per week. She has had one previous loan with SPBD.  She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 370 tala (~$110 US).  SPBD loans are Salafune’s only access to capital because she has never been able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. She will use her loan for business improvement.

loans.use: To purchase wheelbarrow, spade, knives, file and fertilizer

loans.name: Juanita

texts.en:
Juanita P. is from the village of Solano,Nueva Vizcaya. Juanita is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Juanita owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops.
