While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting & harvesting  a variety of vegetables for sale. 

Juanita joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Juanita is requesting a new loan, which will be used to purchase general farm supplies and equipment. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of the borrower's children.

loans.use: to purchase general farm supplies & equipment

loans.name: Erenia

texts.en:
Mrs. Erenia L. is 40 years old and married with eight children but only five fully dependent. She lives with her husband, a hard working trackman named Ching Guan Jing Corp. Supported also by her daughter working in Manila, she receives P2,000.00 a month. Mrs. Erenia is a business-minded person. She has her own vegetable farm and she also buys and sells vegetables at the public market in Ozamiz City. She started her business in 1998. At this time, Paglaum MPC helps Mrs. L. Erenia with financial, savings and insurance services. 

Now she wants to have her own motor vehicle for their business with the help of KIVA financing through Paglaum MPC.

loans.use: To purchase a motor vehicle for her business

loans.name: Koeun

texts.en: The person who is standing on the farmland is Mrs. Koeun R., age 35, who is a married woman and the mother of three childR. who are of school-age. She currently cultivates a rice crop on her own farmland that was inherited from her grandparents. Her husband works with her in the farm field. Koeun R. planted her rice crop three months ago but her crop is not growing well due to the lack of fertilizer. Therefore, she requested a loan of $200 to purchase more fertilizer to fatten her crop yields.

loans.use: To purchase more fertilizer to fatten her crop yields

loans.name: Oyun

texts.en:
Oyun J. is a single mother with three children. She lives with her three sons in Arhangai province, one of Mongolia's central provinces. Her oldest son is 25 years old and works as an engineer for a local mining company. The next son drives a cab in the town. Her youngest son is 18 years old and goes to a local high school.

Oyun plants various vegetables on a small plot of land she owns and sells those vegetables once they are harvested. She has been in the business for the last six years. She started her vegetable-growing business with small capital of 100,000 MNT ($1 USD = 1,450 MNT) in 2003 and her working capital currently ranges between 1,000,000 MNT to 4,000,000 MNT depending on the harvest season. She has just recently started small-scale bee farming.

In the future, Oyun would like to continue to expand both her vegetable-growing and bee-farming businesses on her own. She says that she is very optimistic and excited about her businesses. She requests a loan to purchase more bees and vegetable seeds for her businesses.

loans.use: To purchase more bees and vegetable seeds for her businesses

loans.name: Rosalina

texts.en:
Rosalina M. is a 44-year-old single mother of five children. Her eldest child is now in college. They all live together in a small house in a hilly community of Lumil, Silang, Cavite.

Life was hard for her when her husband passed away a few years ago, but she never lost hope. She worked hard and went into business. Her variety store is now three years old. She also maintains a small stall which she rents out to other entrepreneurs. Combined, she earns P 15,000 per month.

2006 was a banner year for Rosalina. It was when she joined the Center for Community Transformation (CCT) Credit Cooperative upon the invitation of her friends. Now, she benefits from both loans provided by the cooperative to support her business and the company of women entrepreneurs in her community.

Rosalina has applied for a new loan of P 10,000 which she will use to purchase merchandise like rice and soft drinks for her store. She looks forward to converting her small store into a large grocery store some day.

About CCT

The Center for Community Transformation (CCT) is an organized Christian response against poverty and social injustice. This is carried out through the fusion of social development initiatives and evangelical mission in a uniquely Filipino context. It serves urban and rural poor communities throughout the Philippines, in pursuit of its desire to see changed lives, strong families, and transformed communities centered in the Lordship of Jesus Christ.

loans.use: Additional merchandise such as rice and soft drinks

loans.name: Mrs. Roatha Chhun Village Bank Group

texts.en:
ThirteE. people who all live in Pou Roung village in Takeo province make up this village bank loan, and they will use the loan for different purposes. Mrs. Roatha C. is the village bank president, and she is a farmer who owns a small piece of land where she cultivates rice to earn a living. Aside from this planting, she is a grocery store owner in the local village. Her husband, Mr. Thoang Nimun, helps her in the rice farming.

Although Mrs. Roatha C. and her husband try to work hard, they still earn too little income to support the family. Thus, Mrs. Roatha C. decided to ask for a loan to buy a cow to start up a cow-breeding business. Mrs. Roatha C. is 39 years old and the mother of three childrE. who are all attending the local school.

ElevE. members in this village bank loan have end-of-term loans so these persons are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make their payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s client make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: to buy a cow to start up a cow-breeding business

loans.name: Esterlita

texts.en:
Esterlita D. is from the village of Maribojoc,Tudela,Misamis Occidental. She is 57 years old. Esterlita is married and has 7 adult-aged children. To make a living, Esterlita owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector running a general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Esterlita has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 3,500.00 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2005, Esterlita joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Esterlita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 14,900.00 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory & working capital. Esterlita is requesting a new loan of 14900 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the 7th loan taken out by Esterlita from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of the borrower's family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Jowali's Group

texts.en: M. Jowali is the leader of his lending group in Mukono. He is a hard working and responsible man. M. is married and has 5 children, the eldest being in Senior 1. His family also cares for 2 orphans. Jowali is a driver in Mukono. He has had a taxi business, which he operates on the Mukono – Kampala route, for 13 years and he is happy that at least he is able to earn 100,000 UGX a week. He is mostly challenged with the occasional problem of mechanical failure. However, the loans plus a little savings helps him in sorting this out. He knows how to treat his customers well and this has enabled him to win their trust. He needs a loan to help pay for his children’s school fees and to repair his taxi.

loans.use: Towards children's school fees and for repairing his taxi.

loans.name: Siya

texts.en:
Mrs. Siya S., 54 and her husband, Mr. Vandy Phoung, 55, were married in 1985 and have three children: two daughters and one son, two of them are garment factory workers. The family lives along National Road Number Six about twenty kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Siya has been raising pigs for almost 2 years, while her husband has been a farmer for over 5 years. He grows rice and vegetables for food. Siya is requesting her first loan of $500 to build pigpen for her pigs.

loans.use: To build pigpen for her pigs.

loans.name: Mammy Group

texts.en:
Here are Mohamed F. and Musa T.. They are small-scale entrepreneurs in the northern city of Makeni. They are seeking a loan of Le 1,000,000.00 each to enable them add more goods into their businesses. In this way, they will be able to make more sales and better profits. Consequently, they can better support their children in terms of feeding, clothing and in their academic pursuits. 

Mohamed F. (on the left in the photograph) is the leader of this group. Mohamed is forty years of age. He was born in Makeni. He is married to a businesswoman and they have four children, three in secondary schools and one in primary school. Mohamed has been a businessman for over twenty years. He sells used clothing – window cottons, bed sheets, towels, handkerchiefs etc.

loans.use: Invest in his business

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John M. is 33 years old and is single. He is in the business of buying and selling gas cylinders in Mshomoroni, Mombasa. John's business is 2 years old and is doing well.

John is taking out his first loan from KADET and with the 50,000 KES loan he plans to buy gas cylinders and to also purchase distilled water. He sells gas to residents of Mshomoroni and he says he is proud of the success he has been able to have with his business. 

John hopes to expand his business and open up more locations in different areas of the coastal city of Mombasa.

About KADET: 
The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is dedicated to economically empower her clients by providing financial services to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Kenya. KADET is the microfinance subsidiary of World Vision Kenya. Obtain more information on KADET from the website: www.kadet.co.ke

loans.use: To buy gas cylinders and distilled water to sell to customers

loans.name: Vida

texts.en: Vida is a 33-year-old divorced mother of five children who are in school. She lives with her children in a rented apartment in a farming town in the western region of Ghana. Most of the inhabitants practice farming alongside other trading activities. Vida is a trader. She trades in plantain. She supplies to retailers and food vendors in her community. She also treks to supply. Vida buys the plantain from nearby communities. She has been in business for four years and wants a loan to procure goods in bulk to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy plantain in bulk

loans.name: Elnora

texts.en:
Elnora D. is from the village of Ibung Villa Verde, Nueva Vizcaya. She is 42 years old. Elnora is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Elnora owns & operates a general store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Elnora has been engaged in her business for over 4 years and earns approximately 1,500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2007, Elnora joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Elnora has successfully repaid a previous loan of 11,000 PHP from ASKI. Elnora is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the fifth loan taken out by Elnora from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About ASKI:
ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk, and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Juan Boanerge

texts.es:
En el municipoio de San Rafael del Sur en la ciudad de Managua, el señor Juan G. se dedica a trabajar como guarda de seguridad siendo este trabajo muy cansado pero él está comprometido con el bienestar de su familia y por esto es que trabaja fuertemente para llevar el sustento a su hogar.

Actualmente atraviesa una gran necesidad en su hogar y es que su vivienda ha estado en malas condiciones y para ello ha iniciado a mejorar su vivienda y está solicitando un crédito para la compra de los materiales de construcción como hierro, cemento y bloque para llevar a cabo esta obra de mucha necesidad para él y su familia.
texts.en:
In the municipality San Rafael del Sur, in the city of Managua, Mr. Juan G. works as a security guard. This job is very tiring but he is committed to the well being of his family. For this reason, he works very hard in order to support his household.

At the moment, he has a great need in his home. His home has been in bad state and he has started to make improvements. He is requesting a loan to buy construction materials like iron, cement, and cinder block in order to carry out the much needed repairs for Juan and his family.

Translated from Spanish by Lauren Jackson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy iron, cement and cinder block

loans.name: Cristo Es El Camino Group

texts.es:
La alcancía comunal “Cristo es el camino”, está conformado por 10 socios emprendedores quienes viven en la zona alta de Huaycán, distrito de Ate, departamento de Lima, trabajan con EDAPROSPO-prosperidad desde hace 6 años.
Olga tiene 43 años, es separada, tiene 2 hijos de 10 y 20 años, asume el cargo de presidenta desde que se formo la alcancía. 
Desde hace 15 años se dedica a la venta de verduras, con el esfuerzo de su trabajo ha logrado mejorar su vivienda y apoyar en el estudio de sus hijos.
Con el préstamo otorgado será  para destinarlo a la compra de mercadería, nuestros socios agradecen el apoyo brindado y prometen cumplir con los pagos establecidos en las fechas pactadas.
texts.en:
The Cristo Es El Camino Communal Bank is comprised of ten enterprising members. They live in the high area of Huaycán in the Ate district, Lima department. They have worked with Edaprospo-Prosperidad for six years. Olga is 43, separated, and has two children. They are 10 and 20 years old. She has been the president since the communal bank was formed. For 15 years she has been selling vegetables. With the effort in her work, she was able to improve her house and support her children’s education. The loan will be used to buy merchandise. Our members appreciate the support, and they promise to make their payments on time.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy merchandise

loans.name: God Grace Group

texts.en:
Anna G. is the leader of her five-person borrower group named 'God Grace'. Anna is 39 years old, married, and has five children -- two girls and three boys -- that range in age from 4 to 17 years old. Anna says that all of her children are attending school. Anna also helps support her mother, who lives in the countryside.

Anna has a business selling foodstuffs such as beans, rice, and oil, and household staples such as soap. She has had her business in Thinker's Village near Monrovia for about four years, and says she ran a similar business elsewhere for about ten years before setting up shop where she is now. Her customers are people in her community.

Anna plans to use the proceeds of her 6,000 Liberian dollar loan (her share of the 30,000 Liberian dollar group loan) to buy more inventory for her shop. She buys from a large market in Monrovia, Liberia's capital, and transports the goods back to Thinker's Village about 20 kilometers away. She says her hope is to be able to continue to educate her children, and perhaps send some of them on to university one day.

In the photo that accompanies this profile, Anna is at right holding the sign.

About LEAP:

The Local Enterprise Assistance Program (LEAP) is Liberia's largest and oldest continuously operating microfinance institution with 13 branches across the country. Founded in 1994, the non-profit organization has survived periods of civil war and severe socio-economic hardship. LEAP seeks to help rebuild post-conflict Liberia through its group and individual loans to micro- and small-scale entrepreneurs, and puts emphasis on lending to women.

loans.use: To buy beans, rice, cooking oil, soap, and other items for a small general store

loans.name: An

texts.en:
Mrs. An H. (pictured here), age 62, is a widow with three sons and two daughters who weave silk at home. One of them is married and lives in a separate home; one is a construction worker, and another one attends school. They are living on an island in the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia.

Mrs. An H. has been a silk weaver since she was young. She sells her finished products to the middleman in the village who then brings them to sell in Phnom Penh market. She is requesting a loan in the amount of $700 to purchase silk material for her weaving business.

loans.use: To purchase silk materials for her weaving business.

loans.name: Calle 20 De Octubre Group

texts.es:
Estas cinco personas integrantes de este grupo son personas que tienen mucho 
honorabilidad en la comunidad en donde viven, debido a que cada dia 
se esfuerzan en sus pequeños negocios para lograr el desarrollo de sus hijos,
como en la educación, salud y vestuario que sol las necesidades básicas de la
familia, y sobre todo son personas responsables y colaboradoras en la comunidad
y como también se les conoce básicamente atreves de sus negocios como 
por ejemplo: venta de comidas, pollos, ropa y tortillas la cual desde hace 
cinco año vienen desarrollando estas actividades. Atreves de estos pequeños 
negocios han venido superándose ya que anteriormente no cuentan para 
poder pagar los estudios y las necesidades de la familia, por lo tanto para  
que sus negocios tengan estabilidad se vieron en la necesidad de acudir a la
Asociación Asdir para solicitar un préstamo para la continua satisfacción de sus 
necesidades.
texts.en:
These 5 members of the group are very honourable peope in the community where they live. This is owing to the fact that every day in their small businesses they work very hard to allow the development of their children and family, and above all they are all responsible people and collaborators in the community. They are known for their work such as : food sales, chicken, clothes, tortillas, and they have been developing these activities for over 5 years. Because of these businesses they have been able to improve their lives, as previously they couldn't pay for their families' studies and necessities. For this reason to ensure that their businesses remain stable they need to approach Asociación Asdir to seek a loan to continue satisfying their necessities.

Translated from Spanish by Jane McCrory, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Labibeh

texts.en:
Labibeh is a 44-year-old single woman living with her family. She has been working as a private accountant for the past fifteen years, working from her home. She participates with her family in the household expenses, rent, etc.

Labibeh has repaid her first loan and, today, she is asking for her second loan of $1,600 to purchase two computers. These are needed to facilitate her work after having a heavy demand from customers asking for her accounting services.

loans.use: To purchase two computers

loans.name: Romy Denisse

texts.es:
La Señorita Romy  Denisse es soltera y vive en la casa de sus Papas y en compañia de ellos, tiene su movilidad que hace trabajar con un chofer todos los días en el servicio de transporte urbano, ella esta a cargo de los gastos de su familia ya que sus padres ya no trabajan, y ella mantiene el hogar, ella estudia tambien, tiene a su cargo la administracion de los ingresos y que genera, como es todavia soltera y aun no tiene hijos su deseo es terminar de estudiar y poder formar su familia y ofrecerle lo mejor, ella es una persona responsable. el crédito lo esta destinando a reparaciones de la movilidad para poder seguir trabajando con la misma y tambien desea comprar pronto otra movilidad.
Esta muy agradecida con Emprender y Kiva por la confianza brindada en la otorgacion del credito.
texts.en:
Romy Denisse is single and lives with her parents. She has a vehicle that a driver uses daily to provide urban public transportation. She is the household’s sole provider because her parents no longer work. Besides supporting the household, she is also studying. She manages the income. Since she is still single and has no children yet, she wants to finish her schooling so that she can form her own family and offer them the very best; she is a responsible person. The funds will be used for vehicle maintenance and repairs so that it can continue in operation; she also wants to buy a second vehicle soon. She is very grateful to Emprender and to Kiva for the trust placed in her by granting the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For vehicle maintenance.

loans.name: Blanca Azucena

texts.es: Blanca Azucena tiene 27 años, por lo que su actividad económica es la venta de mercadería en general. Esta no es la primera vez que trabaja con Fundación León 2000, por lo que ha sido de gran ayuda, tiene 1 hijo y esta a su cargo. Ella inicio este negocio hace más de 7 años y comenzó con la venta de perfumes y cremas. Por lo que siempre le ha gustado trabajar y depender de sí misma, pues es madre soltera y ha sabido luchar por su hijo sin importar las circunstancias. Ella solicita este préstamo para la compra de cosméticos, ropa, entre otros productos. Siempre desea tener su propio local para ofrecer sus diferentes productos.
texts.en:
Blanca Azucena is 27 yeard old and works selling a variety of merchandise. This is not the first loan she has received from the Leon 2000 Foundation, which has been a great help to her. She has a son who lives with her. She started her business more than seven years ago and began by selling perfume and creams. She has always liked to work and be independent. She is a single mother and has fought to help her son no matter what the circumstances are. She is applying for a loan in order to purchase cosmetics, clothing, and other products. She has always dreamed of having her own store to offer all of her different products.

Translated from Spanish by Patrick King, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Capital to purchase cosmetics and clothing

loans.name: Kumari

texts.en:
Kumari is a 30-year-old married woman living in Kekanadura, a town in the Matara district of Sri Lanka. She has one child and her husband is currently abroad. Kumari has managed a business sewing clothes for six months. She is a hard-working woman.

She has requested a 20,000 LKR loan from BRAC Sri Lanka to help her business and purchase cloth. She is grateful to BRAC Sri Lanka because of the financial support it provides to her.

Thank you for taking the time to consider supporting this Sri Lankan loan!

loans.use: To buy cloth

loans.name: Irshad's Group

texts.en:
Irshad is a wife of Z. A. and lives in a city named Vehari, in Pakistan. She is 40-year-old working lady. She prepares embroidered clothes on order and shares the financial burdens with her husband. She owns a small house with two rooms and has been living in it with her family for over 30 years. She has given birth to three children: two boys and one girl. Her daughter is in 11th grade and her elder son is in 8th standard and the youngest reads in the 2nd standard. 

Irshad's husband operates a dairy business. He purchases milk from the milk shops and sells in the community. Irshad baji and her husband think that in order to compete in this world, one should have his studies completed. This is why they are very concerned about their children’s future. Irshad is applying for a loan for the first time from Asasah (microfinance institute in Pakistan and a partner of Kiva)to purchase a dairy cow for her husband's business. This will allow him to get the milk from his own cow.

They hope to get good profit from this cow so they may save the money and make their children's future secure.

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow for dairy business.

loans.name: En Nombre De Jesus Group

texts.es: Johana Maria, Margarita y Johana conforman el grupo Solidario En Nombre De Jesús. Por lo que juntas forman un excelente grupo pues son personas muy responsables y humildes. Cada una de ellas se dedica a diferentes actividades económicas. Johana Maria se dedica a la venta de leña y frijoles en su humilde vivienda, la mayoría de sus clientes le tienen un gran cariño, pues ella además de ser muy inteligente con su negocio ha sabido aconsejar a sus clientes que algunas veces recurren a su negocio. Ahora juntas las 3 deciden realizar un financiamiento que será destinado para la compra de materia prima para la compra variada de sus productos. Sueñan con seguir adelante y proporcionar a sus familias lo más necesario.
texts.en:
Johana Maria, Margarita, and Johana are the members of the solidarity group “En Nombre de Jesús” (In the Name of Jesus). Together they make an excellent group because they are responsible and humble people. Each is engaged in a different business activity.

Johana Maria sells firewood and beans from her modest home. She has great affection for the majority of her customers. In addition to being very smart about her business, she also provides advice to her customers that they can use in their own businesses.

At the moment, these three individuals have decided to apply for a loan that will be used to buy raw materials and a variety of products. They dream of moving forward so that they can provide for the needs of their families.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital to buy materials & various products

loans.name: Jannett

texts.en:
Jannett F., 38, is making sure that her family has enough provision for its daily needs. Married to Rodrigo F., a maintenance man, they are blessed with two children. Jannett makes sure that she helps her husband earn so that their family can have a better life. She has been managing her own soft drinks business for the past few years.
Jannett has been a regular member of Kiva partner, Center for Community Transformation (CCT), for more than a year now. She regularly attends its weekly fellowship meetings* and pays her weekly dues consistently. Because of her good repayment performance for her previous loans, she has been able to borrow quite a few times from CCT’s cooperative. She is consistent in paying her dues because she used the money she borrowed to expand and improve her soft drinks business.
To ensure the success of her business, she would like to apply for a loan of 10,000 PHP. This amount will be used as a source of added capital to her expanding business by buying more cases of soft drinks to replenish her current product inventory. Jannett dreams that her business will continue to grow so that she can provide for her children’s education. She also dreams of having her own house and lot someday as a result of her hard work in her business.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To buy more cases of soft drinks

loans.name: Milly

texts.en:
Milly is married with five children and all her children go to school. She also takes care of additional family members. Milly changed her business enterprise from selling local brew to selling bananas. She has been in this banana business for a few months. She owns a banana stall in Kawempe market and sells to all categories of people both at retail and wholesale.  She is now proud of the business.  

She wants to use this loan to buy more bunches of bananas and doesn’t incur any transport costs as she buys from her place of work.  She works seven days a week. Her business challenges include seasonality and defaulters.  She aspires to seeing her business grow big and going directly to farmers.  She joined MCDT because she wanted capital to do business.  She resides in and rents a two-roomed house; the family has no access to electricity and piped water.   Her monthly expenses includes food, rent, and school fees.

loans.use: to buy more bunches of bananas

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: BUYING CREAMS, SHAMPOO, GELATINE, AND COLOGNE, AND TO REMODEL HIS BARBER SHOP

loans.name: Rosene

texts.en:
Rosene B. is from the village of Libon, Gingoog City. She is 25 years old. Rosene is married and has 2 infant-aged children. To make a living, Rosene owns & operates a business venture in the services sector providing recycling services. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from buying and selling bottles, plastics & other recyclables for local businesses and community members. Rosene has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 4000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Rosene joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rosene is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional plastics & other recyclables to sell. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Rosene from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional plastics & other recyclables to sell

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther M. is a 53-year-old married woman who supports her family by operating 3 business ventures:   wholesaler of dried fish, general store and fish vending businesses. She lives in Buena Suerte, El Nido, Palawan. 

She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2008 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts.  By working hard in her wholesaler of dried fish, general store and fish vending businesses, she is gradually making her family more economically stable.  She now earns an average monthly income of PHP 5,000. 

Esther is now borrowing PHP 10,000 so that she can purchase raw materials for her business.   This will be her 3rd loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP 7,000, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey towards economic freedom.  Esther aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future well-being by following the Dungganon way. 

About NWTF:

In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed on a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking  the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: Purchase of raw materials

loans.name: Gulmira's Group

texts.en:
Gulmira M. is leader of the group. She is 54 and married. She has two children: her son is 20 and daughter is 14. Her son is a student at an institution of higher education In Kyrgyzstan and her daughter studies in the US. Her husband works in construction. Two years ago, she bought an apparatus for wool scratching with her savings. Since then, she has offered the service of wool scratching. Two years ago, the apparatus cost her 13,500 and now she can get 7,200 soms a month from it. Along with wool scratching, Gulmira decided to start cattle breeding. She applied for a loan to purchase cattle. In the future, Gulmira plans to marry off her son, give her daughter a better education and buy a car.

Group members:
Sovetkan A. is treasurer of the group. She is 34 and married. She has two daughters of 6 and 3 years old. Both of them are at home. Together with her husband, Sovetkan decided to start cattle breeding. She applied for a loan in order to buy cattle for reselling. In the future, with the profits from cattle breeding, Sovetkan plans to educate her children, form a dowry for her daughters and expand her business. 

Asylbek C. is 54 and married. He has two children: his daughter is 25 and his son is 20. His daughter is married and his son is a student. His wife is a teacher in the US. He works as an inspector in the factory “Severelektro”. He plans to start cattle breeding, but he needs funds. Therefore he is applying for a loan to buy cattle for breeding. He plans, in the future, to continue cattle breeding.

Ashat B. is 21 and single. He breeds cattle. He started one year ago, with the purchase of cattle with his own savings from his salary of 12,000 soms. He gets 6,000 soms monthly from cattle breeding.  He is applying for a loan in order to buy cattle for fattening and reselling in the future at a higher price. With the profits from cattle breeding, Ashat plans to buy a house, car, more cattle and save some money for his future wedding. 

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

 This loan is from Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: To purchase cattle

loans.name: Dina

texts.en:
Dina E. is from the town of Banga. She is 26 years old. Dina is married and has four young children. To make a living, Dina raises crops. The main source of income for the business comes from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Dina has been engaged in her business for over five years.

Dina joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Dina has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. 

Dina is requesting a new loan of 6,000 Philippine pesos, which will be used to purchase farm inputs like seeds and fertilizers. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to support her family financially.

loans.use: To purchase farm inputs, like seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Gansuh

texts.en:
Gansuh C. lives with his wife and daughter in the Hentiy province of Mongolia. He lives with his family in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent. His wife works as an accountant in the department of National Security Agency while his daughter is a teacher in the local school.

He operates a taxi service in his town. He began his business in 2006, and at first he was driving a small car of the Excel brand. With his earnings, he was able to upgrade his previous car into his latest and more convenient car, a Sonata. In the four years of running his taxi service, he has gained a good professional reputation among the people of his town as a safe, reliable driver. 

Gansuh would eventually like to buy a larger, more comfortable car, an Istana, so that he can transport more people across longer distances, which would increase his profits. He is requesting a 500,000 MNT loan to repair his car's engine.

loans.use: To repair his car's engine

loans.name: Muheza Group

texts.en:
R. B. is in his late thirties. He is married and has four children. Two years ago, R. began making pool tables. He also buys and sells pool tables that are already made. He operates his business from 7:00 a.m. to 7:00 p.m. daily. His business earns him a good monthly profit.

This will be R.'s third Motisha loan with Tujijenge Tanzania. A Motisha loan is a product offered by Tujijenge Tanzania that allows borrowers with good credit ratings to pay back their original loans faster and receive extra money before their original loan term has ended. R.'s previous loans, which he has since repaid, were used to increase his inventory of materials to be used for building the pool tables. He plans to use this loan to increase his business capital.

R. will share this loan with his loan group, Muheza, which totals 10 members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for repaying the loans.

In the picture, R. is first on the right, standing in the back row.

loans.use: To increase capital for pool-table manufacturing business

loans.name: Byambasuren

texts.en: Byambasuren A. is 27 years old and lives with his mother, wife and two young sons in an apartment in the Songinohairhan district of Ulaanbaatar, Mongolia’s capital city. His wife is currently unemployed and takes care of their two young sons. Byambasuren operates a taxi service in the city. He has been driving a taxi since 2008 and has built a stable operation. He is planning to enlarge and decorate his garage where a cafe managed by his mother and wife will be operated. Starting to operate his second business will enable him to increase his business earnings and improve his family's standard of living. Byambasuren is a hardworking man and is requesting a 1,000,000 MNT loan in order to construct his garage into a cafe.

loans.use: To construct his garage into a cafe

loans.name: Ines Amparo

texts.es:
Ines de 33 años, tiene una pequeña tienda de víveres en la parte delantera de su casa. Vive con su esposo y su hijo de 12 años en una zona urbana llamada Orquídeas porque en su descubrimiento descubrieron muchas flores y en la actualidad hay un parque de estas flores. 
 
Ella hace años atrás comenzó a buscar una actividad económica para ayudarle a su esposo con los gastos familiares. En busca de una actividad económica ella vio que la venta de víveres era rentable y podía pasar tiempo con su hijo. Con unos ahorros compro arroz, azúcar, bebidas y readecuo la parte delantera de su casa para la venta su tienda. En la actualidad ella tiene una pequeña tienda surtida, vende arroz, aceites, bebidas, lácteos etc. Trabaja desde las 06h30am hasta las 22h00pm todos los días.

Con el préstamo quiere comprar arroz por quintal, aceites, bebidas para su tienda y así poderla surtir. En el futuro quiere agrandar su negocio y poder así asegurar el futuro de su familia.
texts.en:
Ines is 33 years old.  She has a small grocery store in the front of her home.  She lives with her husband and her 12 year-old son in an urban area called Orquídeas (Orchids).   The area is so called because when it was discovered they found many flowers there and currently it has a park of orchids.

Years ago Ines began to look for a business activity to help her husband with their family expenses.  In search of an activity, she saw that the sale of groceries was profitable and meant that she could spend time with her son.  She used her savings to buy rice, sugar and drinks and she remodelled the front of her home to incorporate her store.  She currently has a small stocked store.  She sells rice, oil, drinks, dairy products, etc.  She works from 6.30am to 10.00pm every day.

She would like to use her loan to buy 100kg sacks of rice, oil and drinks to stock her store.  In the future she would like to expand her business and thereby be able to guarantee her family's future.

loans.use: To buy rice, drinks and oil

loans.name: Edgar

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal  “PROSPERIDAD”;  El banco comunal está ubicado en el distrito de Huanchac perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco, departamento de Cusco.

El socio es el Sr. Edgar; El socio tiene 25 años de edad, El socio  es soltero; el socio  se dedica a administrar una pequeña empresa de elaboración de tortas y también la venta y distribución de las mismas, el socio trabaja en las tiendas de magisterio y de San Jerónimo.  El socio es natural de la ciudad de Abancay, el socio tiene un pequeño y propio negocio el apertura una tienda de distribución de gas para lo cual requiere mercadería y el invertirá el dinero en la compra de mercadería. El socio solicita el prestamo para invertir en mercadería. 

El socio agradece y valora el préstamo otorgado mediante este medio y del mismo modo se compromete en cumplir con el pago de su cuota en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Edgar is a member of the “Prosperidad” (Prosperity) community bank which is located in Huanchac district, in Cusco province, in Cusco department.

Edgar is 25 years old.  He is single and runs a small company which makes, sells and delivers cakes.  He works for stores in Magisterio and San Jerónimo.  He is originally from the city of Abancay.  Edgar is going to open a business which distributes gas and for this reason he requires merchandise.  He will invest his loan in buying merchandise.

Edgar is grateful for his loan and appreciates it.  He pledges to make his repayments in a timely manner.

loans.use: To invest in merchandise

loans.name: G.s Sangre De Cristo Group

texts.es: El grupo solidario Sangre De Cristo está conformado por Hermenejilda y Rosa Alpina. Ambas tiene diferentes actividades económicas Rosa se dedica a la venta de frijoles y tortillas a pesar de ser una actividad muy humilde siempre está buscando la forma de salir adelante con su familia a pesar de las difíciles situaciones que ha enfrentado. Es por eso que han logrado unirse con tal de realizar mejoras para su negocio, es así que el financiamiento es para la compra de materia prima para cada uno de sus negocios.
texts.en: The group named "Sangre de Cristo" is made up of Hermenejilda and Rosa Alpina. They both have different business types. Rosa sells prepared beans and tortillas. And even though it is a very humble business she has always looked for a way to provide for her family, despite the difficult situations that she has faced. They have come together as a team with the goal of bringing some improvements to the business. This loan will be used to purchase ingredients for each of their businesses.

loans.use: Working capital.

loans.name: Dimas Marin

texts.es:
Don Dimas, reside en Puerto el Triunfo, departamento de Usulután, es empleado de la alcaldía municipal como vigilante, él vive con su esposa y sus hijos, don Dimas a parte del ser empleado sabe desempeñara el oficio de la albañilería.
Don Dimas tiene un inconveniente en su hogar y es no poseer luz eléctrica, es un gran atraso para él y su familia ya que en estos tiempos son pocas las familias que aun viven sin energía; en busca de desarrollarse con su familia ha iniciado el proceso para la debida instalación pero solicita un préstamo para solventar los gastos a la empresa encargada.
Este préstamo ayudara para que esta familia progrese al desarrollo ya que sin energía no tenían aparatos eléctricos y de alguna manera esto dificulta el progreso, su objetivo es mejorar su hogar poco a poco, comenzar por lo más necesario, para optar por una calidad de vida diferente.
texts.en:
Dimas lives in Puerto el Triunfo, Usulután department.  He works for the city as a Watchman.  He lives with his wife and children.  Dimas, besides being employed, also knows the bricklaying occupation.

He has an inconvenience in his house: he does not have electricity.  This is a great step backwards for him and his family in that today there are few families living without eclectic power.  In search of developing with his family he has started the process to have electricity installed but needs a loan to cover the fees charged by the electric company.

This loan will help this family progress toward development because without electricity they haven’t any appliances and this makes progress difficult in one way or another.  His objective is to improve his home little by little, to start with the most necessary, heading toward a different quality of life.

loans.use: To install electricity.

loans.name: Magdalena Del Carmen

texts.es:
Magdalena del Carmen M. M. tiene 60 años, es viuda, vive en el Cantón Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos. No tiene hijos 

Los miembros de la V.R.C. TIERRA NUESTRA se encuentra ubicada en el recinto San Luís de Zapotal pertenece al Cantón Ventanas, esta ventanilla de 14 miembros se dedica a las labores agrícolas en ciclo corto de siembra de maíz, arroz.

Magdalena del Carmen se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, cacao, soya y arroz. Compra sus productos en  Ecua - Agro y vende en el mismo lugar.

Solicita el crédito para sembrar maíz, y arroz, compra de insumos y semillas. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentar desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es tener un carro.

Le gusta sembrar plantas.
texts.en:
Magdalena del Carmen M. M. is 60. She is a widow and lives in the Ventanas Canton, Los Rios province. She has no children.
The members of the V.R.C. Tierra Nuestra ["Our Land"] are located in the San Luis de Zapotal region, belonging to the Ventanas Canton. The 14 members of this community bank work in short-cycle agriculture sowing corn and rice. 
Magdalena del Carmen works in agriculture, sowing corn, cocoa, soy and rice. She purchases her products in Ecua-Agro and sells them in the same location. 
She is requesting this loan for sowing corn and rice, and for buying supplies and seeds. The support of this loan will help her economically to supply her needs. She confronts challenges such as plagues, diseases and the varied climate. Her dream is to have a car.
She enjoys planting plants.

loans.use: the purchase of supplies and seeds

loans.name: Oyundorj

texts.en:
Oyundorj, 39, is married and lives with his wife and three children in Hentii province of Mongolia.  All of his three children attend a local secondary school. He began making wood products in 1994. By saving money from his woodcraft business he bought a car and started a taxi service. In 2003 he began a car repair service. In the beginning he started his business by using his own working capital and from 1999 he became our customer to access loans from our bank. 

With the profit that he made from his business, he enlarged his house by 36 square meters. Thanks to his effort and experience of several years, he now has regular customers and his income is increasing as well.  His wife helps him to purchase necessary spare parts and maintenance. 

Oyundorj is a hardworking, modest and honest person whose ultimate goal is to open his own workshop. He says " I am not an engineer but I like to fix and maintain machines and I have been working in this field for many years. I had to work outside in the cold weather. Now I want to open my own workshop and create new jobs." He is requesting a loan of 3,200,000 MNT to construct a building for his future workshop.

loans.use: To build a building

loans.name: Franklin

texts.en:
Franklin S. is from the village of Olango. He is 40 years old. Franklin is married and has 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Franklin owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Franklin has been engaged in his business for over 20 years and earns approximately 35000 PHP per harvest.

In 2007, Franklin joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Franklin has successfully repaid a previous loan of 26,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase fertilizer such as manure. 

Franklin is requesting a new loan of 30000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This loan will be the 9th loan taken out by Franklin from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer such as manure

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: Additional inventory of fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Zisa Belen

texts.en:
Zisa Belen B. is from the village of Proper Langcangan, Oroquieta City. She is 27 years old. Zisa Belen is married and has an infant. To make a living, Zisa Belen owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector operating a general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling specialty products in the local community. Zisa Belen has been engaged in her business for over one year and earns approximately 1,500 PHP per month for these activities.

In 2011, Zisa Belen joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Zisa Belen is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase hair pins, combs, celphone accessories, bracelets and other products for sale. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Zisa Belen from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to make improvements to her house. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has seven branches covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase hair pins, combs, celphone accessories, bracelets and other products for sale

loans.name: Cissy

texts.en:
Cissy K. lives in the Ndeeba neighborhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda. She is married and has three children, all of whom are in school.  


Cissy has a business selling clothes. She has been in this business for less than one year, and she works seven days out of every week. Cissy sells her products in a shop by means of wholesale and retail. Cissy has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bales of second-hand clothes.

The main business challenges for Cissy are transportation and the rainy season. Her goals and aspirations for her business are to start importing bales of clothes herself. Cissy lives in a home that she owns; she has access to electricity but doesn't have access to piped water. Her major monthly expenses include paying utility bills, school fees, and food.

loans.use: To buy more bales of clothes.

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en:
Gemma is 40 years old and married with two children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari-sari (variety) store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 23,000 loan through NWTF to buy items like shampoo, groceries, etc to sell. 

Gemma has borrowed and repaid 11 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the sari-sari store for 20 years and also earns an income from raising pigs.

Gemma aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy items like shampoo, groceries, etc. to sell in her sari-sari (variety) store.

loans.name: Juditha

texts.en:
Juditha is 45 years old and married with four children.

Juditha works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari-sari store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell in her store.

Juditha has borrowed and paid back 11 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the sari-sari store for seven years and also earns an income from food vending.

Juditha aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: To purchase more stock to sell in her sari-sari store

loans.name: Chann's Group

texts.en:
This group loan is made up of five borrowers, all residents of the rural area of Siem Reap Province. Mrs. Chann S. is chosen by the other members as the group head. Mrs. Chann S. is 49 years old and earns a living as a local tailor, sewing or mending clothes for the villagers. Her husband is skilled in building houses, a knowledge he uses to earn a living. They are blessed with five children, two of them drive a boat for tourists and the other three go to school. Mrs. Chann S. is asking a loan to buy a motorbike for her kids to ride to school as well as going anywhere. 

The other four borrowers are:
Mrs. S. - She is requesting a loan to buy more merchandise to sell.
Mrs. P. - She is a grocery trader, who is applying for a loan to purchase additional grocery items for selling.
Mrs. N. - She is a fish vendor, who is applying for a loan to buy more fish to sell.
Mrs. S. - She is a fish-seller, who is seeking a loan to repair her old house.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike for her kids to ride to school as well as going anywhere.

loans.name: Ferdinand

texts.en:
Ferdinand is a 38 year old man who runs a furniture business. He is married with two children: Kristo, who is 12 years old and in the 1st year of junior high school, and Sandy, who is 9 years old and in the 4th grade of elementary school. He has been running his business for almost eleven years, and he uses it to generate income in order to meet his family’s needs and pay for his children’s educational costs. 

Ferdinand operates his business in front of his own house.  He really enjoys his work and intends to improve the business. He has been in TLM’s group lending program for 5 cycles and has a good repayment record.  He needs more capital, and so is now moving to TLM’s individual lending program and requesting a loan of IDR 10,000,000. He plans to spend the loan on cutting equipment, a fret saw and some beams of wood in order to enhance the continuity of his business as well as to increase his income. He is hoping TLM will approve his loan application.

loans.use: to purchase cutting equipment, a fret saw and some beams of wood.

loans.name: Juana De La Cruz

texts.es: Juana de la Cruz se dedica a la venta y elaboración de rosquillas. Tiene más de 11 años en su negocio, inicio este medio de vida ayudándole a su Mama fue así que con el paso del tiempo que Juana aprendió y decide establecer el negocio en su vivienda. Tiene que levantarse temprano desde las 5 de la mañanas hasta las 6 de la tarde, pues siempre se esfuerza por brindar una buena calidad de sus productos. El crédito es para la compra de maíz, leña, sal, mantequilla entre otros productos.
texts.en: Juana de la Cruz engages in preparing and selling rosquillas (a Nicaraguan type of doughnuts). She has been engaging in this activity for more than 11 years: she started it with her mother’s help, and after having learnt from her Juana decided to open her own shop in her house. She has to get up early, working from 5 am to 6 pm, as she always works hard to offer good quality products. The loan she is requesting will be used to buy maize, firewood, salt and butter among other products.

loans.use: To buy maize, firewood, salt and butter.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary, 50, is married to Edward, who is a contractor, and is blessed with two children aged 30 and 24. She has been in crop farming and dairy farming for 15 years. The business earns her a monthly income of KES 27,000.

This is her fifth loan with KADET LTD, and she has a good credit history. She will use the loan funds to buy a Friesian dairy cow for milk production.

She intends to use the expected profits to expand her farming and hopes to be a big supplier of milk and farm products in the future.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow for milk production

loans.name: America

texts.es: America tiene 38 años, vive en compañía de Cesar, su esposo desde hace 20 años. Ambos tienen 4 hijos, pero solo viven con 3 de ellos en su casa propia ubicada en el caserío de Cayan. El trabajo arduo es su lema, pues America trabaja con mucho ahínco en sus terrenos agrícolas. Hace 10 años que comenzó con la siembra de papa, arveja y olluco; en sus propios terrenos. Los cuales después de fertilizarlos los comercializa en el mercado mayorista de la ciudad de Tarma. Según cuenta, considera que lo más difícil es transportar sus productos, ya que los sacos que lleva son muy pesados y la cansan mucho. Ella siembra 2 veces al año y lo que más le gusta es cosechar, ya que los mismos compradores van a sus propios terrenos, y así evita el tener que trasladar su producción al mercado.  Al mismo tiempo se dedica a la crianza de vacas Holstein que son lecheras; las cuales producen la leche con lo que hace queso. Cada fin de semana recibe ganancias, ya que vende 4 moldes de queso a una comerciante de productos lácteos. Además de tener 3 cerdos a los que cría para poder vender su carne. Ahora está pensando sembrar 20 sacos de papa en esta temporada. Su sueño en el futuro es comprar nuevas tierras para ampliar sus plantaciones. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Corazón de Jesús” y este es el noveno crédito con MFP, donde espera el apoyo de ustedes para continuar con su trabajo. America de obtener su apoyo, invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de varios sacos de abono para comenzar con éxito la siembra de papa de la variedad “yungay”.
texts.en: America is 38 years old. She has lived with  Cesar, her husband, for 20 years. They both have 4 children. but they only live with 3 of them in their house located in the community of Cayan. Hard work is her motto, and America puts a lot of effort into her farmland. For 10 years she has planted potatoes, peas and olluco on her own land. After fertilizing, she sells them in the wholesale market of the city of Tarma. According to her, what she thinks is the most difficult thing is transporting her product, since the sacks are very heavy and they tire her out a lot. She plants twice a year and what she likes the most is harvesting, since the buyers themselves go to her land, and thus she avoids having to transport to the market. She also raises Holstein cows, which are dairy cows. She makes cheese with the milk they produce. Every weekend she receives earnings, since she sells 4 cheese molds to a dairy product merchant. She also has 3 pig that she is raising to sell for meat. Now she is planning on planting 20 sacks of potatoes for this season. Her dream for the future is to buy new land to increase her crops. She belongs to the “Corazón de Jesús” community bank and this is her ninth loan with MFP, where she hopes that your support for her work will continue. With your support, America will invest the money she has asked for in buying several bags of fertilizer to successfully begin planting the "Yungay" variety of potatoes.

loans.use: to buy several sacks of organic fertilizer.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “SEÑOR DE TORRECHAYOC”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Urubamba, perteneciente a la provincia de Urubamba y departamento de Cusco.

El socio tiene 42 años de edad y es casado y tiene 2 hijos; El socio alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de ropa y también trabaja en una empresa de venta de materiales de construcción y el negocio de venta de ropa lo realiza junto con su esposa y juntos sacan adelante a sus hijos, el socio quiere ampliar el negocio de venta de ropa y seguir mejorando en su trabajo. El  socio solicita el préstamo para comprar pantalones, chompas, blusas, casacas y polos al por mayor.
                                                
El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the “Señor de Torrechayoc” communal bank which is located in Urubamba District belonging to Urubamba Province and Cusco Department.

He is 42 years old, married and has two children.  He alternates his daily chores with selling clothes; he also works in a firm selling building materials.  The clothing sales business is a joint effort with his wife and together they support their children.  He wants to expand the clothing sales business and continue improving in his work.  He is asking for a loan to buy pants, jackets, blouses, sweaters and polo shirts at wholesale.

He is happy about the loan and commits to make his installment payments.

loans.use: to buy clothes at wholesale.

loans.name: Ndone

texts.en:
Ndone is a married man. His wife is a business lady and they have one child aged five years old. He runs a restaurant at Mutindwa in Nairobi. He has been in this business for four years now and employs one person. He says that this business is profitable and the challenge he has is financial constraints. 

He is using his loan of Kes 20,000 to buy food items to grow his business and meet the demand of his customers. He hopes to grow his business to a big hotel. He also hopes to give his child a good education to university level. He describes himself as honest, humble and courageous.

loans.use: to buy more food items.

loans.name: Hoa

texts.en:
Hoa is 42 years old and married with a daughter. She lives with her family in Ho Chi Minh City. Her husband earns an income by repairing sewing machines for customers. Hoa has been supporting her family for the past four years by sewing and selling clothes such as trousers, blouses, and t-shirts. 

Hoa is requesting a loan to buy a greater quantity of different fabrics and materials to sell to her customers. She hopes that this will better meet the needs of her customers and attract more customers to her store. Hoa hopes that through her loan she will be able to increase her income to more adequately cover family expenses.

loans.use: to buy fabrics and materials to sell to customers

loans.name: Mujeres Activas Group

texts.es:
El comité Mujeres Activas se formó con la unión D. varias vecinas D. la ciudad D. Mariano Roque Alonso. Actualmente está integrado por 20 mujeres, las cuales formaron un grupo muy unido y capaz D. realizar conjuntamente actividades que fortalecen su compañerismo y trabajo en equipo. Ellas comentan que se unieron por las ganas D. progreso que tienen, ya que desean seguir adelante y darle un mejor estilo D. vida a sus familias.
La Señora Maria es una D. las integrantes del comité, ella es madre soltera D. un hijo, se dedica al comercio. Tiene una despensa hace mucho tiempo, donD. venD. todo tipo D. comestibles, por lo que ya tiene una clientela bien definida, dice que su negocio le genera buenos ingresos por lo que le gustaría seguir con el. Uno D. sus sueños es poder ampliar su local, y D. esa forma forma tener más capacidad, con lo cual podrá aumentar sus ingresos y ofrecer mayor variedad a sus clientes.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra D. comestibles, bebidas, hortalizas y otros para el abastecimiento D. su negocio. Agradece a la Fundación por la oportunidad que esta le da, ya que D. obtener el crédito le será D. mucha ayuda en sus proyectos.
texts.en:
The Comité Mujeres Activas [Active Women's Committee] was created by the coming together of several neighbors in the city of Mariano Roque Alonso. Currently it is comprised of 20 women, who make up a strongly unified group capable of achieving things together that strengthen their camaraderie. They note that they came together out of the desire for progress they share, and so hope to get ahead.  

Maria is a member of the group and is the single mother of one. She runs a retail business and has had a small store for some time, so she already has a regular clientele. She says that her business generates a good revenue and so she'd like to keep it going. One of her dreams is to enlarge her store so as to increase her capacity and increase her income. She is taking out this loan to buy food products, beverages, produce, and more to stock her store. She thanks the Fundación [La Fundación Paraguaya; Kiva field partner] for the opportunity this gives her, as this loan will be a great help with her plans.

loans.use: to buy food products, beverages, produce, and more to stock her store.

loans.name: Elizaphanie

texts.en:
Elizaphanie is a father of a three-year-old child. He is 41 years old and he sells animals such as cows and goats and also foods such as beans and rice.
He has been doing this business for the past seven years and his business is going on well. This business has improved his standards of living. He needs a loan to buy more animals and food stuffs in order to make more food stuffs.

loans.use: to buy animals and food stuff for sale.

loans.name: Farrukh

texts.ru: Фаррух умелый рыболов. Вот уже 20 лет занимается куплей и продажей рыбы. Он женат, имеет 3-х  несовершеннолетних детей. С каждым годом растет спрос в употреблении рыбы, Фаррух  хочет  получить кредит для покупки товара и увеличение оборотного капитала.  Он заранее благодарит вас за вашу доброту и милосердие.
texts.en: Farrukh is a skilled fisherman and has been selling fish for the last 20 years. He is married and has 3 young children. Every year demand for fish increases and Farrukh wants to take out a loan to purchase more fish for his market stall and so increase his profits. He would like to thank his lenders in advance for their kindness and generosity.

loans.use: to purchase goods and increase store's capital

loans.name: Abena

texts.en:
Abena sells food items such as tomatoes, pepper, salted fish and others at Abura. Abena went to senior high school. She is married and has 6 children. Her husband is into carpentry. She has been selling food items for 30 years now. She assists her spouse to feed, educate and clothe her children.

Her loan will be used to buy more food items to sell. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to build a better shop.

loans.use: to buy more food items to sell.

loans.name: Cesar

texts.es:
El señor Cesar, es de la ciudad de Coronel Oviedo, se dedica a la producción y venta de panes, desde chico empezó a trabajar con sus padres y después poco a poco se fue independizando y formo su propia panadería.
El señor está casado con la señora Zulma, tienen un hijo de 12 años que se llama Marcos. Comenta que tiene buena venta, ya que los productos que vende son de muy buen calidad. Por eso dice que tiene siempre buenos ingresos. Desea poder seguir creciendo y de esa forma seguir ayudando a su familia.
Él solicito el préstamo para aumentar más su stock de harina. El señor y la familia agradece a la fundación por la oportunidad que esta le da, porque gracias a esto va aumentar su stock y satisfacer así a sus clientes porque tiene mucha demanda de sus productos
texts.en:
Señor Cesar is from the city of Coronel Oviedo. He makes his living by making and selling bread. As a child, he started working with his parents. Later, little by little he became independent and started his own bakery.

Cesar is married to Señora Zulma and they have a 12 year-old son named Marcos. He remarks that he has good sales because the products he sells are of very high quality. For this reason, he says he always has good income. He wants to be able to continue growing and thus be able to continue helping his family.

He requested the loan in order to further increase his stock of flour. Cesar and his family thank the foundation for the opportunity that they have given him, because thanks to this loan, he is going to increase his stock, and he will be able to satisfy his customers since there is a great demand for his products.

loans.use: to purchase flour for the bakery.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
Rosa pertenece al banco comunal “Nueva Esperanza De Ollantaytambo” y las reuniones de las socias del banco comunal son cada treinta días en la ciudad de Ollantaytambo de la provincia de Urubamba del departamento del Cusco. 

Rosa tiene 29 años de edad y tiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene dos hijos, ella nació en la ciudad Sicuani de  la provincia de Quispicanchis y desde hace 6 años que vive en la ciudad de Ollantaytambo y donde realiza sus actividades económicas. Su actividad económica principal de Rosa es la venta de comida y tiene un restaurante en un local alquilado por las mañana sirve desayuno, al medio día sirve almuerzo y por las noche sirve pollos a la brasa. Ya son 6 años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo.  

En esta oportunidad Rosa requiere el préstamo para implementar el restaurante y desea comprar mesas y sillas.    

Rosa agradece y valora el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas mensuales.
texts.en:
Rosa is a member of the 'Nueva Esperanza de Ollantaytambo' community bank.  The members of the bank meet once a month in the city of Ollantaytambo, in Urubamba province, in Cusco department.

Rosa is 29 years old and lives with her common-law husband.  The couple have two children.  Rosa was born in the town of Sicuani, in Quispicanchis province and has lived in the city of Ollantaytambo for six years.  This is where she carries out her business.  Rosa's main business activity is selling food and she has a restaurant which is located in rented premises.  In the mornings she serves breakfast, at midday she serves lunch and in the evenings she serves charcoal-grilled chicken.  She has been in this business for six years and it is doing very well thanks to the effort that she puts into her work.

On this occasion, Rosa needs a loan to equip her restaurant.  She would like to buy tables and chairs.

Rosa is grateful for this loan and appreciates it.  For her part, she pledges to make her repayments on time.

loans.use: to equip her restaurant and buy tables and chairs

loans.name: Bunjojo Sacco Group

texts.en: John is a 48-year-old married man with four children living in Fort Portal, Uganda. He sells fresh fruit, especially yellow bananas. He began with five bunches of bananas, but now he sells 106 bunches a week. His dream is to educate his children and expand his business. The challenge he faces is the high prices of the fruit. John needs the loan to buy fresh fruit to sell.

loans.use: to buy fresh fruits to sell

loans.name: Adoracion

texts.en:
Adoracion is 59 years old, widowed, and has two children.  She lives in Pasay City, Philippines. Together with her children, she manages their household while operating her general store. At this time, she is working hard to provide income for their everyday expenses.  

Adoracion's store is basically a small convenience store, which sells groceries, toiletries, and beverages. She earns money by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling them by the piece. Her store is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns approximately 1,000 PHP in sales a day.

Adoracion is requesting a loan for 50,000 PHP to help her continue operation of her business. She will use the loan to buy groceries, toiletries, and beverages to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands. 

Adoracion hopes to give all her children a good future through all her hard work. She meets weekly with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work and study the word of God.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to purchase grocery items and other products.

loans.name: Ibrahim

texts.fr:
Né vers 1980 à Koutiala, Ibrahim est un homme marié qui est père de quatre  enfants.Il vit avec sa famille à Loulouni ville, une des  sous préfectures de Kadiolo.
 Ibrahima  mène cette activité de soudure et  vente de  portes isoprènes + fenêtres +  chaises, il y a environ six  années. Il jouit d’une forte réputation dans cette activité et reçoit beaucoup de commandes, mais ses ressources ne peuvent pas lui permettre de les satisfaire. C’est ainsi, qu’il décida de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso. Il est à son quatrième prêt  et tous les prêts antérieurs ont été correctement remboursés.
Il compte acheter avec son prêt, des feuilles de tôles, des baguettes de soudures, et des barres de fer. Cela pour ses prestations et la fabrique des portes isoprènes + fenêtres +  chaises qui seront mis à la vente.
Il envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 140 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé pour  assurer l’essentielle des  dépenses de l’atelier, contribuer à celles de la famille, payer les intérêts de son prêt et investir le reste dans son activité.
texts.en:
Born around 1980 in Koutiala, Ibrahim is a married man and father of four children. He lives with his family in the town of Loulouni, one of the sub-prefectures of Kadiolo.

Ibrahim has been running this business of soldering and selling isoprene doors + windows + chairs, for about six years now. He has a strong reputation in the business and receives lots of orders, but he doesn't have enough resources to carry out all of the orders that are placed. That is why he decided to start working with Soro Yiriwaso. He is on his fourth loan, and all of his previous loans were properly repaid.

With his loan, he plans to buy sheet metal, solder sticks, and iron bars, for his services and the making of isoprene doors + windows + chairs to be sold.

He expects to make a monthly profit of 140 000 FCFA, which will be used to cover most of the expenses of the workshop, some family expenses, and pay off the interest on his loan. He plans to invest the rest of his profits into his business.

loans.use: to buy sheet metal, solder sticks, iron bars

loans.name: Badegnadjourou Group

texts.fr:
Les quatre membres du groupe  BADEGNADJOUROU  sont des femmes mariées avec une moyenne d’âge de 25 ans, et ont en moyenne 3 enfants. Elles vivent la plupart dans des familles monogamiques au   QUARTIER BABEMBA,  un des nouveaux quartiers de la ville de Sikasso (3ème région administrative du Mali). 
Elles sont à leur huitième prêt avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle. Ce groupe fait le commerce d’articles divers tels les savons, les chaussures, les habillements et de la restauration.
Madame   ROKIA deuxième à  gauche fait le commerce de chaussures dans ce groupe.
Elle compte acheter avec son prêt 100 paires de chaussures qu’elle revend en détail au marché de Médine à Sikasso et en famille à une clientèle composée généralement de femmes au comptant. 
 Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 25 000FCFA dont une partie est  utilisée  pour payer le prêt et son intérêt et l’autre pour son épargne
texts.en:
The four members of the Badegnadjourou group are married women averaging 25 years of age with three children. They live mainly in monogamous families in Babemba, a new district of the town of Sikasso (the third administrative district of Mali).

They are on their eighth loan with the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance institution, with the goal of meeting customer demand. This group retails various articles such as soap, shoes, clothing and cooked food. 

Mrs. Rokia, the second on the left, is the one selling shoes. She plans to use her loan to buy 100 pairs of shoes to retail for cash at the Médine market of Sikasso as well as out of her home,  usually to female customers. She plans to achieve an average monthly benefit of 25,000 West African francs, one part of which will be used to repay the loan with interest and the other put aside as savings.

loans.use: to buy shoes [for resale]

loans.name: Kuya

texts.en:
Kuya is 34 years old and married to Nemama.

He has been in the seed business for the last 3 years and earns a monthly income of Kes 20,000.  He is applying for his first loan of Kes 20,000.  He was introduced to KADET LTD by a credit officer.

He hopes to use the funds to buy more planting seeds for sale and to expand his business.

loans.use: to buy more planting seeds for sale and to expand his business.

loans.name: Saly Bambara Group

texts.fr:
Ce Banc Villageois est créé le 26 décembre 2011, lors de son inauguration. Il est composé de 50 femmes issues toutes de la même localité. C'est leur première expérience avec CAURIE. Et leur solidarité de groupe consiste une garantie pour leurs crédits.

Madame Fatou située à gauche  de la photo habillé en uniforme rouge bordeaux  est responsable du Banc Villageois. Elle est âgée de 54  ans. Elle est mariée  et mère de  7enfants

Elle développe une activité de vente de tissu dans son quartier Elle dispose d une bonne expérience dans ce domaine d'activité pour l'avoir pratiqué depuis plusieurs années.
