Son nouveau crédit de 50000 avec CAURIE lui permettra de financer son activité en achetant des tissus et du lait de toilette.

Elle a comme objectif de prendre en charge les besoins scolaires et sanitaires de ses enfants.
texts.en:
This Banc Villageois was created and inaugurated on December 26th 2011. It is composed of 50 women who are all from the same area. This is their first experience with CAURIE. And the solidarity of their group is a guarantee for their loans.
Fatou, on the left side of the picture, wearing a pink attire, is the representative for the Banc Villageois. She is 54, married, and a mother of 7.
She is starting a fabrics selling business in her neighborhood. She has been working in this field for a few years, which gives her a good experience.
This new 50,000 loan with CAURIE will enable her to finance her business by buying fabrics and lotion.
Her goal is to take care of her children's school fees and medical expenses.

loans.use: to buy fabrics and lotion to be resold.

loans.name: Abena

texts.en: Abena is married and has 7 children. For two years, Abena has sold fanti kenkey (boiled maize dough) in Mbem. Her husband is a farmer. Abena uses her income to support her husband in paying their children's school fees. Abena will use the loan to purchase maize in bulk for the preparation of her banku (fermented maize paste). With the new profits, Abena plans to expand her business.

loans.use: purchase maize in bulk for the preparation of her banku.

loans.name: Linet

texts.en:
Linet is 33 years old and the single mother of three children, age 16, 12 and 6 years, 

She runs a business of selling second-hand clothes, a business that has existed for four years.

She has borrowed a loan of KES 50,000, with which she intends to purchase more stocks. The anticipated profit will help her repay her loan and pay school fees.

This is her second loan. Her hope for the future is to educate her children in good schools.

loans.use: To buy more second-hand clothes for sale.

loans.name: Maximillan  Apeli

texts.en:
Maximillan is 24 years old and married. She does tailoring to earn a living. She has engaged in this business for three years.  In addition, she sells small fish (omena) to supplement her income. 

Since she became a client of Faulu Kenya, Maximillan has learned how to save because she has been trained on financial management. She dreams of expanding her business in the future. She has requested for a loan of 20,000 KES to buy fabrics.

loans.use: buy fabrics

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Keteo wants to buy 4 four steers

loans.name: Madina

texts.en:
Madina Carmona F. is 42 years old and originally from Maputo. She is married, but while growing up she lost her mother when she was just 8 years old. Her family's financial situation did not allow her to study. Since 1981 she has been working in her family's business in Boane at a store in the local Boane market. In 2006 friends and neighbors introduced her to Hluvuku-Adsema. She became a member and obtained a loan to grow her business. Her business grew to a new level and she applied for other loans. Now her business is doing very well and provides employment to one worker (her son). The profits from her business have helped her meet her daily needs, cover the school expenses of her two children, and improve the the condition of her home. She plans to use the loan of 13,000,000MT to increase her stock and the variety of products. Her business has a large impact on the community. In addition to providing a usefull service she also provides the school with students' uniforms.

Translated from Portuguese by Kiva Volunteer Julie Lerch

Madina Carmona F. de 42 anos de idade, natural de Maputo, casada maritalmente cresceu sob a responsabilidade dos pais, onde veio a perder a sua mãe quando tinha apenas 8 anos de idade, a situação financeira da família lhe criou poucas oportunidades para estudar. Desde 1981 no Distrito de Boane vem assumindo na integra a gestão de negocio da família e possui uma banca comercial no mercado de boane. A partir do ano 2006, por curiosidade de amigas e vizinhas também elas comerciantes teve conhecimento da existência da Hluvuku-Adsema, tendo aproximado e solicitado um empréstimo para ampliação do seu negocio. Desde então, o seu negocio conheceu outra dinâmica tendo solicitado outros empréstimo. Actualmente, o seu negocio esta num bom ritmo e providencia emprego um trabalhador (seu filho homem), com os rendimentos do negocio tem lhe ajudado muito para o próprio sustento diário, suporte de despesas escolares para 2 filhos e no melhoramento das condições da sua residência. Com empréstimo de 13.000,00 MT, pretende aumentar o stock e diversificar os artigos. A sua actividade tem um impacto maior na comunidade porque para alem de proporcionar emprego para ela própria mais o filho, presta um serviço útil para sua comunidade, com particular destaque para todos residentes nas redondezas do mercado e comunidade escolar com uniformes para alunos.

loans.use: To increase the stock of products in her shop

loans.name: Raul Enrique

texts.en:
For five years now I have had a small shop where I sell stationery, calendars, stickers, notebooks, pencils, and other such products. My clients are the neighboring offices and the community where my store is located. I now wish to buy more products to offer a better service to my clientele.

Translated by Kiva volunteer Maite Barragán

Desde hace 5 años tengo un pequeña tienda de venta de papeleria, calendarios, calcomanias, libretas, sticker, lapices y otros. Mis clientes son oficinas sercanas y la comunidad donde tengo mi negocio. ahora quiro comprar mas productos para dar un mejor servicio a mi clientela.

loans.use: Purchasing stationery, etc..

loans.name: César

texts.es:
Mr Cesar is 45 years old. He is married and lives in a small house with his wife and two children, the oldest is 10 and the youngest 7. His children attend school, and Cesar is proud of them for enjoying it. He hopes that his children can continue studying, especially since he did not have this opportunity.

Cesar produces and sells milk. For 15 years, he has owned cows. At this time, he raises four with the help of his wife. Previously, he worked in Argentina as a construction worker, and after several years of saving he managed to return home. At first, he purchased 2 dairy cows, but once business began to grow, due largely to production, he purchased two more cows.

Right now, Cesar owns four cows, and business is doing well. He supplies various businesses in the city. About a month ago he started working as a supplier to an important business that demands a large amount of milk every day. In order to provide to all his clients he is aksing a loan to purchase one more cow. The 600 dollar loan would allow him to acquire a cow and increase his production.

Translated from Spanish by Marco Alves, Kiva Volunteer.

El Sr. César tiene 45 años; es casado, vive en una pequeña casa con su esposa y sus dos hijos, el mayor de 10 años y el menor de 7 años. Sus hijos van a una pequeña escuela en el campo, César nos cuenta de que esta muy orgulloso de sus hijos pues les gusta estudiar, el desea que sus hijos puedan seguir estudiando ya que el no tuvo esa oportunidad en la vida.

César se dedica a la producción y venta de leche; tiene cuatro vacas que ordeña con la ayuda de su esposa desde hace 15 años; anteriormente estuvo trabajando en la Argentina como empleado en una construcción y tras varios años de ahorro pudo volver a su país; en principio compro 2 vacas lecheras y a medida que el negocio fue ampliándose y gracias a su buena producción adquirió 2 vacas más.

Hoy día César cuenta con 4 vacas, y el negocio marcha muy bien; es proveedor de varios negocios de la ciudad; hace un mes empezó a trabajar como proveedor de una importante empresa que le demanda una buena cantidad de leche todos los días, para poder abastecer a todos sus clientes el está pensando en adquirir una vaca más, para ello necesita un préstamo de $ 600 con los que adquirirá la vaca y aumentará su producción.

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow

loans.name: Touch

texts.en: Mrs. S. V. Touch, 34, lives in Phnom Penh, Cambodia. Her husband earns $1 a day as a soldier, whilst she earns some extra money selling fruit at the local market. Between them they have 2 children who are both students. S. V. Touch is applying for this loan so that she can purchase more fruit in order to more effectively meet clients demand. She would also like to branch out into selling soft drinks.

loans.use: to purchase more fruit and soft drinks in order to meet her clients' needs.

loans.name: I Putu Darmawanta

texts.id:
To have his own furniture business in Putu Darmawanta's goal since he married Ni Made Murtini 6 years ago. However, because lack of capital, this parents of Ni Putu Aprilianti awaits his dreams by working as furniture maker in other people's business. Because of his hard work and persistent, Putu Darmawanta saved little by little to buy his craft's tools. Although the tools Putu owns are stll manual, it was enough as starting capital, besides his expertise. After Two years, Putu Darmawanta furniture business expanded quite well, orders after orders came, since his production were quite good, clean and guaranteed quality, so that his customer base increased. With Dinari's loan, Putu Darmawanta could complete his business machineries with larger machines like grinder, saw and other machines. Within one business day Putu Darmawanta with 3 laborers could produce Rp 1,000,000 (about US$110) worth of goods, with a nett profit of Rp 150,000 (about US$16.50). Putu Darmawanta is happy with his current achievements, and hopes it would continue expanding, and absorb more workforce, and to pay for family expenses, including mother in law expenses who stays with them.

Translated from Bahasa Indonesia by Gwan Liong Ang, Kiva volunteer.

Memiliki usaha meubel sendiri merupakan cita –cita Putu Darmawanta sejak menikah dengan Ni Made Murtini 6 tahun yang lalu . Namun karena tak punya modal , orang tua dari Ni Putu Aprilianti ini menunda keinginannya dan bekerja sebagai tukang meubel di usaha milik orang lain. Berkat ketekunan dan kerja kerasnya , Putu Darmawanta mengumpulkan sedikit - demi sedikit hasil yang didapat untuk di belikan alat-alat pertukangan . Meski alat –alat yang Putu miliki termasuk alat yang masih manual, itu cukup sebagai modal awal disamping ketrampilan / keahlian yang sudah dimiliki. Dua tahun sudah Usaha meubel Putu Darmawanta berjalan dan usaha itu berkembang cukup pesat , pesanan demipesanan pada berdatangan mengingat hasil produksi Putu Darmawanta cukup baik, rapi dan kwalitasnya terjamin sehingga pelanggannya makin hari makin bertambah . Dengan tambahan modal dari Dinari , Putu Darmawanta telah melengkapi mesin – mesin usahanya dengan mesin yang lebih besar Seperti : Mesin Serut , Gergaji dan mesin mesin lainnya . Dalam satu hari usaha Putu Darmawanta dengan 3 orang tenaga kerja tukang bisa berproduksi sebesar Rp.1.000.000,- dengan keuntungan bersih yang didapat sebesar Rp.150.000,- . Putu Darmawanta merasa sangat senang dengan usaha yang dijalankannya sekarang , dan berharap usaha ini terus berkembang sehingga bisa menyerap tenaga kerja yang lebih banyak lagi dan untuk mencukupi keperluan keluarga termasuk menanggung biaya hidup Ibu mertua yang tinggal bersamanya.

loans.use:
To buy grinder & other machines to increase productivity

Membeli mesin serut untuk mempercepat kerjanya

loans.name: Doeun

texts.en:
Mrs. P. Doeun (aged 34) and her family live in a small village about 16 kilometers south of Phnom Penh. Mrs Doeun and her husband have been married since 1993 and have four children: two sons and two daughters. All of her children attend school in their village. Mrs Doeun has been selling vegetables and fish in her village for 12 years while her husband has been a construction worker for 5 years.

She is requesting this, her first loan with Maxima, for US$600, to buy vegetables and fish for resale. Mrs Doeun hopes to continue to grow her business so that she can support her children’s studies to the highest possible level and also study languages such as Chinese and English.

loans.use: To purchase vegetables and fish for resale

loans.name: Zikrillaeva

texts.en: Zikrillaeva M. lives in the Nausky region of Tajikistan with her husband and three children. She has been a Microinvest client since 2005, and is widely respected as a serious and energetic businesswoman. A school teacher by training, she now runs a small IT service that gives customers access to computers and IP telephones, and provides photocopying and printing services. She is requesting a loan of $825 to improve and expand her computer center because she believes that by doing this, she can also increase her family's income.

loans.use: To improve and expand a computer center

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Diversify her stock and make more improvements to her store

loans.name: Shakooran's Group

texts.en:
I am Shakooran S.. I am from Multan, a city famous for its shrines in Pakistan. I have lived in this city for the last 35 years. I am married and the mother of eight: five boys and three girls. One of my sons is an electrician and wants a loan for his electric goods store.

I would like to borrow with a group of several other women. Abida B. sells rugs and mats. Sakina B. is borrowing to buy a rickshaw. Nosheen B. will fix her family’s rickshaw with her share of the loan. Rashida B. is acquiring the loan for her tailoring business. I wish these women a bright future for their families.

loans.use: Expand electric goods store

loans.name: Maria De Los Angeles

texts.es:
Maria de los Angeles is married and has 4 children. Some years ago, her husband found himself unemployed and struggling to get work. While this was going on, their outlays, from school fees to utility bills, went on rising. The situation was very difficult which is why she began reselling cosmetics that she bought from a catalog along with merchandise that she sourced from the city of Monterrey. Later, she set up a stall in a flea market. She now has two places for selling, one in the flea market and another in her house. Bit by bit, her business continues to grow.

She's applying for a US$950 loan, to be repaid in 6 months, to buy merchandise. With your help, Maria de los Angeles will continue to prosper.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

María de los Ángeles es casada y tiene 4 hijos. hace algunos años su esposo se encontraba desempleado, y estaba batallando para conseguir trabajo, mientras esto pasaba las cuentas por pagar ese iban incrementando entre los gastos de la escuela y recibos de servicios la situación era muy difícil por lo que ella empezó a vender, productos cosméticos por catalogo y así empezó a surtir mercancía en la ciudad de monterrey para revender, después se estableció en un local de la pulga, actualmente ya tiene dos locales uno en la pulga y otro en su casa, poco a poco su negocio sigue creciendo.

Ella solicita un crédito por US $950 que pagara en 6 meses para comprar mercancía. Con tu apoyo Ángeles seguirá prosperando

loans.use: Buy merchandise for resale.

loans.name: Logia Esther

texts.es:
The activity to which Logia A. puts such great effort is the rental of videogames, having her own establishment in her home in the municipality of Villanueva in the city of Chinandega.

It is necessary to point out that Logia is a very hard worker who has managed to carry on thanks to the unconditional support provided by Ceprodel, which allows her to acquire videogames and provide maintenance for all the equipment. Today, she faces the urgent need to acquire financial resources to provide the necessary maintenance to the videogame stations. She trusts that Ceprodel will support her by offering the requested loan.

Translated from Spanish by Evelyn Garcia, Kiva Volunteer.

La actividad económica a la que muy esforzadamente se dedica la dama Logia A. es al alquiler de videojuegos teniendo su propio establecimiento de alquiler en su casa de habitación en el municipio de Villanueva de la ciudad de Chinandega.

Es necesario destacar que la señora Logia es una dama muy esforzada que ha logrado salir adelante gracias al apoyo incondicional proporcionado por Ceprodel el cual le permite adquirir los videojuegos y darle mantenimiento a cada una de las maquinas. Hoy en día la necesidad atravesada por la dama Logia es la urgencia de adquirir el recurso económico para darle el respectivo mantenimiento a las maquinas y es por esto que espera confiadamente en que Ceprodel le apoyará brindándole el crédito necesario.

loans.use: Invest in the purchase and maintenance of videogame stations.

loans.name: Mukimjon

texts.en: Mukimjon M. was born in 1961 in the Asht region of Tajikistan. Like many of his fellow villagers he is engaged in the livestock business. Mr. M. is very experienced in livestock; he has been in the business for 20 years. He has a large herd. His business includes raising the livestock and selling meat and milk-sour products he makes. He is married and has five children so he has to work hard to ensure good lives for his family. He works as a tractor driver on a collective farm. Now Mr. M. is applying with KIVA with a request for financial support. He requests a business development loan of 2100 STJ for 8 months to open a trade outlet to sell meat.

loans.use: Mukimjon would like to open a trade outlet to sell meat.
